The representative of the group, by the name of Germaine, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. Germaine is 32 years old and lives in Bénin. Germaine stopped school at the primary level. Germaine does not live with her husband anymore. Germaine is mother to two children who both go to school and are under her care. Germaine lives alone with her children. Germaine takes care of the diverse household responsibilities alone.

In order to meet her needs and those of her children, Germaine has been managing a business selling food products (corn etc.) and charcoal in her neighborhood for about ten years. Germaine gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. 

In order to satisfy her clientèle and to grow her turnover and her income, Germaine is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Fifagbe 2 group. The first three loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products (corn, etc.) and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Mavis' Group

texts.en:
Mavis is 30 years old. She sells materials and shoes in Takoradi. She lives in a rented room with her husband and a child. 

With the loan, Mavis wants to buy more materials to raise her inventory and sales for good income. She believes this loan will help her to save more money and also to expand her business and move into a store.  She is a member of the group called “Spirituality”. Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Mahudjro Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Albertine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Albertine est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Albertine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Albertine est mariée à un conducteur de taxi du nom de Janvier. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Albertine vend depuis une dizaine d’année des plastiques et des tissus par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Albertine vend des chaussures. Albertine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Albertine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Mahudjro group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to elevate the level of their business.

The representative of the group, by the name of Albertine, is the one who has her hand raised on the photo. Albertine is 37 years old and lives in Bénin. Albertine did not go to school. Albertine is married to a taxi driver named Janvier. The couple has three dependent children who all go to school. The couple takes care of the family responsibilities together.

In order to take care of the diverse household responsibilities, Albertine has been selling plastics and fabric by the distribution system for about ten years. At the same time, Albertine sells shoes. Albertine gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. 

In seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her turnover and her income, Albertine is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Mahudjro group. The first three loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy plastics, fabric and shoes.

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
Johana quien habita  en Leon , se dedica a una de las labores propias de las comunidades aledañas a la ciudad la crianza de cerdo . Tiene dos  hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad . Inicio su negocio a los 22 años de edad aunque su primer negocio fue la venta de sodas , tacos , bolsitas pero después se dedicó a la crianza de cerdo que es donde vio la oportunidad de crecer como mujer de negocio y sacar adelante a su familia. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de cerdos de reproducción. Quiere especializarse en técnicas que le ayuden a la crianza de este tipo de animales además de poner una pequeña pulpería que es uno de sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Johana, who live in Leon, works at one of the occupations associated with the communities surrounding the town, that of pig breeding. She has two children, aged 8 and 2. She started this business when she was 22, however her first business involved selling sodas, tacos and cartons of beverages. She later turned to pig breeding where she saw the opportunity to grow as a business woman and move her family forward. 

She needs this loan to buy breeding pigs. She wants to specialize in techniques that help in breeding this type of animal. Another of her projects is to set up a small store.

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio Hugo sigue trabajando en una empresa publica,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio termino de estudiar la carrera de geologia y ahora quiere sacar su colegiatura y de este modo salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ser profesional.El socio solicita el credito para pagar la colegiatura de su carrera profesional de geologica.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hugo continues working in a public company.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He finished his studies for a career in geology, and he now wants to pay to register for his professional credentials in order to get ahead.  His dream is to be a professional.

He is requesting the loan to pay the fees to register for his professional credentials.

He is happy about the loan and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay to register for his professional credentials.

loans.name: Las  Abuelas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las abuelas , sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así por que la mayoría de las señoras del grupo ya son abuelas y también  se consideran abuelas del grupo madres de sus compañeras.
El grupo esta conformado por  nueve   señoras trabajadoras humildes ,creativas ,artesanas y con grandes virtudes.
Ellas nos cuentan que están muy contentas por que  con su trabajo  se siente orgullosas de sus raíces de ser indígenas de usar naguas y de ser mexicanas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Mónica  una señora trabajadora , que se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas manteles desde hace  doce años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio  cocer y elaborarle  figuras a sus servilletas y manteles.
Doña Moni  como mejor la conocen sus compañeras del grupo esta ,felizmente 
casada con el señor Margarito con quien tiene tres hijos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas hilos de colores,ajugas  y listones para  la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
Doña Moni nos cuenta que desde pequeña empezó a tejer ya que su madre se dedicaba a hacer servilletas para venderlas en los pueblos vecinos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son :
María – quien se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas.
Modesta- quien se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas.
Cecilia- quien se dedica a la venta de elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
Ciria- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Luciana- quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas.
Rocío – quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.
Josefa – quien se dedica a la venta de servilletas y manteles.
Inocencia- quien se dedica a la elaboración  de servilletas.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les  ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida   y seguir haciendo lo que les gusta que es hacer servilletas y manteles.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Abuelas.  The members decided to name it that because the majority of the women in the group are already grandmothers, and they also consider themselves grandmothers of the group, mothers of their companions.  The group is made up of 9 hardworking, modest, creative women, artisans with good virtues.  They tell us they are very contented because with their work they feel proud of their indigenous roots, of wearing  
"naguas" [traditional skirts], and of being Mexican.

One of the members of the group is Mónica, a hardworking woman who has worked making napkins and tablecloths for 12 years.  She tells us that what she likes most about her business is sewing and making the figures on her napkins and tablecloths.  Moni, as her companions of the group know her, is happily married to Margarito, with whom she has three children.

She requested the loan to buy more colored thread, needles, and ribbon to make napkins and tablecloths.  Moni tells us that she began to weave at a young age because her mother worked making napkins to sell in the neighboring towns.

The other members of the group are María, who makes napkins; Modesta, who makes napkins; Cecilia, who sells napkins and tablecloths; Ciria, who sells napkins; Luciana, who sells napkins; Rocío, who sells napkins and tablecloths; Josefa, who sells napkins and tablecloths; and Inocencia, who makes napkins.

They are grateful to the foundation for the support it has given them to get ahead, to triumph in life, and to continue doing what they like, which is to make napkins and tablecloths.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and ribbons for embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
María Milagros tiene 26 años, es natural de chincha, Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura emprana de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante y 2007 terremotos Perú, pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia. Es  una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, tiene una hija de 3 años a la que ama mucho, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 meses, sus principales clientes con las amas de casa de su barrio, a quienes les ofrece sus productos visitándolas en sus hogares. 

Actualmente ella vive en la casa de su madre, a la cual apoya con los ingresos que ella percibe gracias a su trabajo, su pareja la apoya llevándola a visitar a sus clientes en la moto taxi que está pagando, esta es básicamente para brindar el servicio de transporte en ciudades aledañas, lo que les permite tener ingreso extra. María nos comenta que aun están pagando este vehículo por lo que en muy poco tiempo será considerado como de su propiedad. 

En este momento desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla para comprar más ropa de temporada para vender y así mejorar  sus ingresos y con ello hacer crecer su negocio, ella desea poder pagar en 15 meses el total de su créditos. Este dinero podrá ayudarle a incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Milagros is 26 and is a native of Chincha.  Chincha is so-named because of the Pre-Columbian culture of the Chinchas, celebrated for their advanced knowledge and their maritime feats.  Today Chincha is an incredible blend of cultures, with a large Afro-Peruvian population and the rest coming from an indigenous heritage and influences from the Spanish empire.  The city, together with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2007 earthquakes in Peru, but it has endured like it has for a large part of its history.  María Milagros is a woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She has a 3-year-old daughter whom she loves very much.  She has sold clothing for 8 months.  Her main customers are the housewives in her neighborhood, and she offers them her products by visiting them in their homes.

She currently lives in her mother's house, and she supports her with the income she makes thanks to her job.  Her husband supports her by taking her to visit her customers in the motorcycle taxi that he's paying for.  This is basically to offer transportation services to neighboring cities, which lets him make extra income.  María tells us that they are paying off this vehicle, and it very little time it will be their own.

Right now, she hopes that Kiva lenders can help her buy more seasonal clothing to sell so she can improve her income and grow her business.  She wants to be able to pay off her entire loan in 15 months.  This money will help her increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cica Célestine

texts.fr: Cica Célestine est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Cica Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Cica Célestine ne vit plus avec son mari. Cica Célestine est mère d’un enfant scolarisé qui n’est plus à sa charge. Cica Célestine vit seule. Pour assurer ses divers besoins, Cica Célestine vend depuis dix sept ans, des tissus, des ustensiles de cuisine et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Cica Célestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Cica Célestine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Cica Célestine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Cica Célestine is 52 years old and lives in Bénin. Cica Célestine did not go to school. Cica Célestine does not live with her husband anymore. Cica Célestine is mother to one child who goes to school and is no longer under her care. Cica Célestine lives alone.

To take care of her diverse needs, Cica Célestine has been selling fabric, kitchen utensils and shoes by the distribution system for seventeen years. Cica Célestine gets her supplies in a market of Bénin and in Lomé. Thanks to the income that this business generates, Cica Célestine contributes to the different expenses of her family. 

To satisfy the needs of her increasingly growing clientèle, Cica Célestine is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en: Beatrice is forty-five years old. She is divorced and lives in her own house in Takoradi with three children. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey (a local meal made from maize powder) and fried fish. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and fish to increase her stock of goods and to expand her business. She will also save towards her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “Mount Carmel”. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and rely on peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vit avec son mari et leurs quatre enfants.Pour participer à la prise en charge des besoins de sa famille et subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle exerce un commerce de tissus et de produits de beauté.Actuellement, elle sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 250000f pour acheter 10 rouleaux de tissus.Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine au marché central.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman. She lives with her husband and their four children.

To participate in taking care of the needs of her family and to meet her own needs, she runs a shop selling fabric and beauty products.

At present, she is requesting from the UIMCEC a loan of 250,000f to buy 10 rolls of fabric. Her goal is to buy a canteen at the central market.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: A sus 67 años, la señora Maria Esther se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina a crédito a familiares, vecinos y amigos de las veredas aledañas al municipio de Marinilla ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años y le ha permitido generar los ingresos necesarios para su sustento diario y apoyar económicamente a sus siete hijos. La señora Maria Esther necesita de la compra de mercancía con la cual pueda impulsar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y salud.
texts.en: Maria Esther is 67 years old. She sells women’s clothing with installment payments to relatives, neighbors and friends on the outskirts of the city of Marinilla. The city is located to the west of Antioquia. She has had this business for eight years. The business has allowed her to generate the necessary income for her daily livelihood and for helping her seven children economically. Maria Esther needs to purchase merchandise to promote her business and to improve the quality of her life and her health.

loans.use: purchase women's clothing.

loans.name: Ayomassè

texts.fr: Ayomassè est âgée de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayomassè n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Ayomassè est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Nestor. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leur mère. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Ayomassè vend depuis huit ans des charbons de bois et divers produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, et cassoulet). Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Ayomassè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Ayomassè sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Ayomassè ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Ayomassè is 45 years old and lives in Bénin. Ayomassè never went to school. Ayomassè is married to a driver by the name of Nestor. The couple has four dependent children of whom some go to school. The children live together with their mother. The couple takes care of the diverse household responsibilities together.

To contribute to the diverse needs of her family, Ayomassè has been selling charcoal and a variety of food products (corn, beans and cassoulet) for eight years. Thanks to the income that this business generates for her, Ayomassè contributes to the different family expenses.

To satisfy the needs of her increasingly growing clientèle, Ayomassè is requesting for the third time a loan from ALIDé. The two credits previously received by Ayomassè were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, cassoulet and corn.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian, vive con su hija y su mama, ella administra una panadería (pan francés, pan dulce) ya tiene veintiocho años de dedicarse a este oficio  junto con su madre, trabaja todos los día lleva su producto en un automóvil que posee a repartirlo a sus clientes en tiendas.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más materia prima como, harina, manteca,huevos, levadura, para incrementar su producción debido a la demanda que hay en varias zonas, y de esa forma obtener más ingresos.
El objetivo de Mirian es mejorar su negocio, satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y que su hija siga estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mirian lives with her daughter and her mother. She manages a bakery (sweet and French breads). She now has been in this position for 28 years along with her mother. They work together every day. They make deliveries in a car they own to their customers at stores. 
The loan is needed to purchase more basic materials like flour, butter, eggs and leavening in order to increase their production due to the demand in some areas. With this increase in demand, they can obtain more profits.
Mirian’s objectives are to improve her business, to satisfy her basic necessities and to have her daughter continue her university studies.

loans.use: purchase flour, butter, eggs and leavening.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
De 57 años de edad, originaria de León, es doña María una sencilla ama de casa y comerciante quien tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, es casada, madre de tres hijos los cuales son mayores de edad pero ella se hace cargo de sus padres. Su experiencia en el mundo del comercio la adquirió desde muy joven cuando vendía mercadería general de manera ambulante luego puso una mini tienda de mercadería en general y hace tres años que inicio con su negocio de pulpería gracias a estas actividades con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio preparo a sus hijos para que tuvieran una profesión y se desarrollaran en la vida además de hacerse cargo de sus padres que ya están ancianos y que ella misma cuida.  
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar ropa, calzado y cosméticos para surtir su mini tienda. Uno de sus planes es pintar y mejorar la infraestructura de su local y hacer crecer su pulpería que es de mucho beneficio para las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Doña María, 57 years old and a native of León, is an unassuming housewife and merchant who has a small store in her home. She is married and the mother of three children. They are all adults, however she cares for her parents. 

She gained experience in the world of commerce when she was very young and sold general merchandise as a street vender. Later she set up a mini-store selling general merchandise and three years ago started her small grocery business. Thanks to these businesses, and with great effort and sacrifice, she saw to it that her children became professionals and were able to progress in life. At the same time she was looking after her parents, who are now quite elderly and whom she herself cares for.

María has taken out a loan to buy clothing, footwear and cosmetics in order to stock her mini-store. One of her plans is to paint and improve the infrastructure so that she can expand, since her store is a great convenience for people in her community

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear and cosmetics to stock her mini-store.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Odile est mariée à un certain Cyriaque. Le couple a trois enfants  dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Odile vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Odile vend depuis quinze ans de divers produits (blé, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, riz, etc.), des tissus et des chaussures par le système de distribution et à son domicile. Odile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Odile contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Odile sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Odile is forty-two years old and lives in Benin. Odile is married to Cyriaque. The couple has three children, some of whom are in school, and all are in their care. Odile lives alone with her children. The couple ensures together the various expenses of the house. To contribute to the various needs of the family, Odile has sold various products (wheat, pasta, conserves, rice, etc.), fabrics and shoes through a distribution system and at her home for fifteen years. Odile stocks up in a market in Benin. Thanks to the revenue that this business generates for her, Odile contributes to the different expenditures of her family. To satisfy the needs of her growing clientele, Odile is asking for a fourth loan from Alidé. Her three previous loans have been paid off.

loans.use: to buy various products (bags of wheat, pasta) and fabrics.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 46 años, es casada, tienen dos hijos. Vive con su esposo y sus hijos en Ibarra, Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. Rosa es una persona amistosa muy responsable en su trabajo ya que le gusta hacer sus actividades diarias.

Rosa trabaja sola en la crianza de animales como cuyes, cerdos para criarlos y despuén sacarlos a la venta en las ferias libres o a clientes que ya se ha ganado por su autoestima y sus animales de calidad. Es el séptimo crédito que realiza en Fodemi, el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, cerdos para comercializarlos entemporada de navidad y fin de año ya que en este mes las ventas se incrementan y de la misma manera los ingresos económicos que le permitirá mantener a sus hijos dándoles un buen estudio y buena alimentación.

Su sueño es poder construir corrales para sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, is married and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ibarra, a town in the northern Ecuadorean province of Imbabura.  She is a friendly woman, hard-working and responsible, and she likes what she does.

Rosa operates a business raising and selling animals: pigs and cuyes, for example.  She sells them at local markets or to long-standing customers who come to her because they know her animals are of good quality.  This is her seventh Fodemi loan and she will use it--like her loans before--to buy more animals.  She wants to ensure that she can meet the extra demand for her animals over the holidays.  The income from the business will allow her to provide her children with a healthy diet and pay for their school fees.

Rosa would like to build a pen to keep her animals.

loans.use: to buy cuyes and pigs for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Mahoutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTIN est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Vidéhou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Vidéhou est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Félix. Vidéhou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Vidéhou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Vidéhou mène comme activité depuis trois ans, la vente de tissus et de boisson locale à son domicile. Vidéhou s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Vidéhou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN, un deuxième crédit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The MAHOUTIN group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood.  This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase their activity.  Vidéhou, the group's facilitator,  is the woman raising her hand on the photo.  Vidéhou is 34 years old and married to a man named Félix.  Vidéhou stopped going to school at the secondary level.  She lives with her husband and children.  Vidéhou and Félix have two children who attend school and whom they financially support.  Vidéhou and Félix take care of the various household expenses together.  In order to provide for her family, Vidéhou has been selling fabrics and local drinks at her home for three years.  Vidéhou buys her merchandise in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her income, Vidéhou is requesting a second loan, together with the other members of the MAHOUTIN group.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and local drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of raw foo-foo and fire-woods in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha  tiene 56 años de edad, ella vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agro exportaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  En su tiempo libre disfruta Leer;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Martha  le gusta mucho es el Chicharrón de chancho. Martha estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria y le hubiera gustado estudiar derecho. Martha es madre soltera, y tiene 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden  24, 21, 19 y 15 años,  todos ellos han estudiado hasta quinto de secundaria.		
	
Martha se dedica al comercio, tiene una bodega en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, se dedica a este trabajo aproximadamente diez horas diariamente, se animo en poner este tipo de negocio porque en la zona donde vive no hay muchas bodegas y esto le permite tener un promedio de 15 clientes en un día, esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de S/.40 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 60. Ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito porque ella ofrece productos de buena calidad y un trato amable. Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y tener más productos que ofrecer.

Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener una bodega con productos variados y que los clientes se sientan a gusto con los productos que ofrece, con el transcurso del tiempo, mucha dedicación y entusiasmo podrá cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propia Pizzería en el centro de la ciudad de Ica."
texts.en:
Martha is 56 years old and lives in Ica, a city currently characterized by increased investment, not only in agricultural exports but also in the opening of new commercial centers that create many employment opportunities for residents of Ica.

In her free time, Martha enjoys reading. It is well known that Peru has the most delicious foods in the world, and one of Martha's favorite dishes is pork cracklings. She studied until the second year of secondary school and would have liked to study law. Martha is the single mother of four children who are 24, 21, 19, and 15 years old. They have all studied through the fourth year of secondary school.

Martha is a merchant who has a bodega [small grocery store] where she sells staple goods. Martha works approximately ten hours a day. She was encouraged to open this type of business because there aren't many bodegas in the area where she lives, so she is able to average 15 customers a day, which brings in an average of approximately 40 nuevos soles per day. On a good day, she can earn up to 60 nuevos soles. Martha thinks her business is successful because she offers good quality products and treats her customers kindly. 
	
This will help her to stock her bodega with a variety of products so that her customers will feel pleased with the merchandise offered. With time and a great deal of dedication and enthusiasm, she will be able to achieve her greatest dream: "To have her own pizzeria in the center of Ica."

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Jose Abdubar

texts.es: Jose, necesita invertir nuevamente en agricultura, por eso solicita un préstamo para el pago de mano de obra y pago por el alquiler de una  desgranadora de maíz para procesar la cosecha que obtuvo, esto le ayudará para tener el maíz listo para el consumo de su familia y para ofrecer a la venta. El considera que la cosecha que ha obtenido ha sido abundante, producto del préstamo anterior, ya que le sirvió para darle los cuidados necesarios a esta producción.
texts.en: Jose needs to invest in agriculture again. In order to do so he is requesting a loan to pay the labourers and rent a corn sheller to process the harvest. This will help him to have the corn ready for his family's consumption and for sale. He says that his harvest has been abundant thanks to his previous loan, which he used to take care of his crops.

loans.use: to pay labourers and rent a sheller.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: El señor Cipriano es nuevo integrante del grupo, el va a comprar con su préstamo blusas y pantalones de dama, el tiene 48 años de edad, es casado tiene 1 hijo varón que estudia la primaria, el vende ropa, el solicito su préstamo para comprar blusas y pantalones para dama, el inicio su negocio hace 10 años, por falta de recursos económicos fue comprando poco a poco, el ofrece a su clientes faldas, blusas, camisas pantalones, ropa interior de dama y niñas, el sale a vender su mercancía los fines de semana va de casa en casa ofreciendo la ropa, su negocio es importante porque va sacando para la comida y para los gastos de la escuela de su hijo, el se siente feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar para surtir su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido de ropa y así tener mas mercancia para ofreceerles a sus clientes. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que su hijo se supere, que siga estudiando y que venda mejor su ropa. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por la confianza que nos tienen, que sin conocernos nos ayudan con sus préstamos y le vamos a echar ganas a trabajar en los negocios para vivir mejor con la familia”.
texts.en:
Señor Cipriano is a new group member. He will use this loan to buy blouses and women's pants. He is 48, married, and has one son who is in elementary school. Cipriano sells clothing and has requested this loan for the purchase of blouses and women's pants. He started his business 10 years ago, and because he did not have much capital he has been buying stock bit by bit. He offers skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, and underwear for women and girls. He goes out to sell his merchandise door to door on weekends.
His business is important for providing his family's daily bread and for covering his son's school costs. Cipriano is happy to have this loan. He will use it to stock his business in order to have lots of merchandise to offer his customers. His hopes and dreams are to sell better clothing and for his son to succeed and keep studying. The group members have the following message for Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad:
"Thank you very much for your confidence in us. You don't even know us, but you are helping us with our loans. This encourages us to work in order to improve our families' lives."

loans.use: to buy blouses and women's pants.

loans.name: Tolohoun Lache Group

texts.fr: Le groupe TOLOHOUN LACHE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidikatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sidikatou est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Sidikatou a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Sidikatou est mariée à un certain Imourou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidikatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Sidikatou vend depuis sept ans, des oignons et des piments dans un marché du Bénin. Sidikatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sidikatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TOLOHOUN LACHE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Tolohoun Lache group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to elevate the level of their business.

The representative of the group, by the name of Sidikatou, is the one who has her hand raised in the photo. Sidikatou is 42 years old and lives in Bénin. Sidikatou stopped school at the primary level. Sidikatou is married to a certain Imourou. The couple has three dependent children who are all in school. Sidikatou lives together with her husband and her children. The couple shares the household responsibilities.

In order to take care of the diverse household responsibilities, Sidikatou has been selling onions and hot peppers in a market of Bénin for seven years. Sidikatou gets her supplies in a market of Bénin. 

In seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her turnover and her income, Sidikatou is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the Tolohoun Lache group. The first three loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions and hot peppers.

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Juana va a utilizar su préstamo para reparar su taxi del motor que esta desvielado, las señoras María Elizabeth y Catalina van a comprar abono por bulto para fertilizar su siembra de nopal. La señora Juana tiene 34 años de edad ella es casada tienen 2 hijos varones que estudian uno la preparatoria y otro la secundaria, ella solicito su préstamo para reparar su taxi del motor se desvíelo, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años, su esposo es taxista pertenece a la asociación Flor de Tuna da servicio al público en general donde sus clientes quieran sus viajes, su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene para beneficio de la familia, a ella le gusta su negocio porque sale de viaje, conoce otras comunidades y se siente orgullosa de tener su concesión, ella esta planeando conseguir otra concesión y lo piensa lograr con la venta de la producción de nopal y trabajando el taxi. Su negocio le ha ayudado económicamente para citas y tratamiento de su hijo más pequeño está enfermo de los ojos, sus sueños y esperanzas son obtener otras concesiones, construir unas recamaras en el 2°. Piso y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para lograr una carrera y que su hijo más pequeño este bien de salud que se recupere de sus ojos. Ella está feliz con el préstamo que le van a dar, gracias a esto va a volver a trabajar el taxi. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su apoyo y su generosidad por prestarnos para salir adelante y seguir trabajando en los negocios”.
texts.en:
The new members of the group are Juana who is going to use her loan to repair the motor of her taxi which is inoperative and María Elizabeth and Catalina are going to buy compost in bulk to fertilize their nopal crops. 

Juana is 34 years old. She is married and has 2 sons, one in high school and one in junior high school. She is asking for a loan in order to repair the engine of her taxi. She began her business 5 years ago. Her husband is a taxi driver belonging to the Flor de Tuna association serving the general public going where their customers want to go. 

Her business is important because the earnings that she makes benefit the family. She likes the business because of the travel. She gets to know other communities and she feels pride that she has her own concession, and she is planning to get another permit next year thinking of her nopal production and her concession. 

Her business has helped her financially because her youngest son has eye problems and she pays for appointments for treatment. 

Her dreams and hopes are to have more stands, to build a bedroom on the second floor and that her children continue studying to become professionals and that her youngest son has good health and recovers from the eye problems. She is happy with the loan that you are giving her. Thanks to this she can return to work in the taxi. 

The members of the group want to thank Kiva and the Fundación Realidad. “We thank you for your help and generosity in lending to us so we can get ahead and continue working in our businesses.”

loans.use: to repair the engine of the taxi

loans.name: El Durazno Group

texts.es:
La señora Domitila tiene 39 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que trabaja en el campo, ellos tienen 1 hija mayor de edad ya trabaja, ella tiene sus huertas de zarzamora y aguacate, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar abono y agua para sus plantas, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años sus hermanos le dijeron que sembrara zarzamora y plantas de aguacate ya que en su comunidad se dan las frutas y también le enseñaron a plantarlas y cuidarla, su negocio es importante porque le proporciona ingresos para comer y para comprar otras cosas para su casa, ella se siente orgullosa de tener sus plantas de cuidarlas, que no les falte nada, su negocio es popular por el sabor de la fruta. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio plantar mas plantas para tener más frutas, ella está emocionada con su préstamo que va a recibir lo va a invertir en abono para que produzca mucha fruta, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir progresando con su negocio con sus hertas de zarzamora y tener salud para seguir trabajando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante en nuestros negocio y con la familia”. 
*La señora de pie que está atras de la señora del rebozo blanco no pertenece al grupo, pero de igual manera quería tomarse una fotografía**
texts.en:
Domitila is 39 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship with her husband who works in the field. She has 1 older daughter who is already working. 

She has her garden with blackberries and avocados. She is asking for a loan to buy compost and water for her plants. 

She began her business 7 years ago. Her siblings told her to plant blackberry and avocado plants because their community gives them the fruit and also teaches them to plant and care for them. 

Her business is important because is gives her income to eat and to buy other things for the house. She feels proud of having her own plants to care for, that lack nothing. Her business is popular because of the flavor of the fruit. She is planning to expand her business, planting more plants to have more fruit. 

She is excited with the loan that is is going to receive. She is going to use it for compost in order to produce lots of fruit. Her dreams and hopes are to continue to progress with her business and her blackberry garden and to have good health to continue working. 

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “thank you very much for the loans, thanks to you we can get ahead in our business and family.” 

Note: The lady standing behind the woman in the white shawl is not a group member, but wanted her picture taken.

loans.use: to buy compost and water for her blackberry seeding

loans.name: Hada Luz

texts.es:
Hada, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, para la compra de ropa nueva en Blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior para este mes que espera que sus ventas sean mejores, por eso pretende disponer de mercadería nueva y a la moda.
Ella considera que través de estos prestamos ha podido aumentar su negocio y las ventas, dándole una mayor solvencia frente a sus obligaciones con su hogar.
texts.en: Hada is once again asking for a loan to buy new clothes: blouses, skirts, pants and underwear for this month when she expects her sales to be better so she wants to have new, up-to-date merchandise on hand.  He believes that through these loans she’s been able to increase business and sales giving her better solvency with respect to her household obligations.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: E Hadji Balla

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un commerçant qui vend des aubergines.Il exerce cette activité depuis près de trois ans et arrive à générer des revenus assez importants pour entretenir sa famille et subvenir à ses propres besoins.Face à la forte demande due à l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000f pour acheter 1 tonne d'aubergine.
texts.en:
The borrower is a shopkeeper who sells eggplant. He has been running this business for almost three years and manages to generate fairly significant income to support his family and meet his own needs.

Faced with large demand due to the approaching festive season, he is requesting a loan of 150,000f to buy 1 ton of eggplant.

loans.use: to buy 1 ton of eggplant.

loans.name: Tabaksineh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tabaksineh” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 500,000.00 SLL, for each, in order to expand their respective businesses. They will buy more goods to add to their businesses. As a result of improved businesses, their sales, profit and standards of living will improve. 

The leader of this group is Isatu. Isatu is thirty-five years of age. She was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school, the other is not yet of school going age. Isatu has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells ready-to-wear-clothes. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy shoes, shirts and jeans to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts and jeans to add to her business.

loans.name: Flor De Azar Group

texts.es: La nueva integrante del grupo es la señora Anita va a comprar con su prestamo uniformes para los alumnos de la primaria y secundaria. La señora Julieta Pastora tiene 46 años de edad, ella tiene un puesto de dulces, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar bombones, paletas de caramelo, galletas, chicharrones y una parte para la escuela de sus hijas, su negocio es importante porque está en su casa y puede atender a sus hijas, ella se siente orgullosa de poder salir adelante con sus hijas, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años su esposo le dio para comprar los dulces, sus hijas tambien le ayudan a atender a los clients, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir en dulces y para algún imprevisto de enfermedad o gastos de la escuela, ella está planeando echar colado a su local para vender pozolelos fines de semana, ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar su mercancía para que su negocio este bien surtido. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijas sigan estudiando. Las integrantes de grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante y la familia está mejor”.
texts.en:
The new group member is Anita who will use her loan to buy uniforms for elementary and secondary school students.  

Julieta Pastora, 46, has a candy stand.  She asked for the loan to buy bonbons, caramel lollipops, cookies and fried pork rinds and part of it for her daughters’ schooling.  Her business is important because it’s home-based so she can watch over her daughters.  She is proud to be able to get ahead with her daughters.  

She started the business three years ago; her husband gave her money to buy the candy.  Her daughters help her tend to customers.  She uses profits to reinvest in candy and also for unexpected illnesses or school expenses.  She’s planning to lay a concrete floor in her locale to start selling pozole on the weekends. 

She is happy with the loan she’s going to get and is going to use it to buy merchandise so that her business will be well-stocked.  Her dreams and hopes are that her daughters stay in school.  

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for the loans.  Thanks to you we can get ahead and the family is better.”

loans.use: to buy candy, bonbons, caramel lolipops, cookies and fried pork rinds and part of it to pay for her daughters' schooling.

loans.name: Yolanda Ysabel

texts.es:
Yolanda Isabel  tiene 31 años de edad, ella vive en Ica ,ciudad caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agro exportaciones, es decir en los fundos, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a pobladores iqueños.  Ella hace de su trabajo su tiempo libre ya que es muy dedicada;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Yolanda le agrada mucho es el “Arroz Con Pato”. Yolanda Isabel estudió hasta  Terminar su carrera. Yolanda Isabel es casada, perforación de pozos tubulares, juntos tienen 2 hijos el menor cursa educación inicial y el  mayor de sus hijos cursa el cuarto año de primaria.	

Yolanda se dedica a su negocio de Cevichería, el cual consiste en ofrecer platillos a base pescado y mariscos, se dedica a este trabajo aproximadamente 8 horas diarias, su esposo la animo en realizar el negocio ya que los platos a base de pescado y mariscos tienen mucha acogida. En un día Yolanda Isabel puede atender diariamente a 35 clientes por día. Ella cree que su negocio tiene éxito porque el sabor de sus platos es muy agradable y también sabe que brinda una rápida atención a sus clientes.

Ella desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla para que pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de platos, a base de mariscos, con su esfuerzo y dedicación ella podrá incrementar sus ventas, lo que la acercará a cumplir su gran sueño “Tener una cadena de Cevicherías”.
texts.en:
Yolanda Isabel, 31, lives in Ica, a city currently noted for increased investment not only in agricultural exports, that is on the large plantations, but also with the opening of new shopping centers that provide many job opportunities for Ica residents.  

She does her work in her free time since she’s very dedicated.  As she well knows, Perú is noted for having the most delicious dishes in the world and one of the dishes that Yolanda likes very much is “Arroz con Pato” [rice with duck].  Yolanda completed her studies in her career.  She’s married.  Her husband works digging wells.  They have two children.  The youngest attends preschool and the oldest is in fourth grade.

Yolanda’s business is a cevichería, a business based on dishes made from fish and seafood.  She works about 8 hours daily in her business.  Her husband encouraged her to go into this business because dishes based on fish and seafood are very popular.  In a day, Yolanda Isabel might tend to 35 customers daily.  She believes that he business is successful because the flavor of her dishes is very pleasant and she also knows that she provides quick customer service.

She wants Kiva lenders to help her so that she can offer a greater variety of seafood-based dishes.  With her effort and dedication she’ll be able to increase sales which will get her closer to her great dream: to have a chain of cevicherías.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: El Jardin Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Reina va a comprar con su préstamo elotes, la señora Marisol va a comprar hojas blancas, tóner para la impresora y va a pagar internet, la señora Esbeybi va a comprar un tablón, un comal, la señora María Esther va a comprar mesas, sillas y un triciclo, las demas integrantes estan trabajando en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Esbeybi tiene 27 años de edad, ella es casada tienen 2 hijos varones uno estudia la primaria y otro preescolar, ella vende tortillas a mano, gorditas, picaditas, dobladitas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar maíz, manteca, aceite, carnes, un tablón, sillas, y un comal, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años su mama tenia este mismo negocio y ella le enseño a hacer las tortillas a mano y a cocinar, su negocio es importante porque le gusta vender y tiene trabajo, ella se siente orgullosa de saber hacer las tortillas a mano, sus clientes son los vecinos, los estudiantes, los trabajadores que van al campo, ella los atiende bien les prepara los antojitos con amor para que tengan buen sabor y sus clientes regresen, ella está planeando comprar un tablón, mesas y sillas y lo piensa logran con el préstamo. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos agradecidas con sus préstamos, piensan en las personas de escasos recursos, nos ayudan a seguir adelante en los negocios, gracias por confiar en nosotras”.
texts.en:
The new group members are Reina who will use her loan to buy ears of corn, Marisol who will buy blank sheets of paper, toner for the printer and pay Internet access fees, Esbeybi who will buy a large board and a griddle, María Esther who will buy tables, chairs and a three-wheeled cart; the rest of the group are working in their activities that they are developing.

Esbeybi is 27 years old.  She’s married and has two boys, one in elementary school and the other in preschool.  She sells hand-made tortillas, gorditas, picaditas, dobladitas [traditional Mexican fast food snacks].  She requested her loan to buy corn, lard, oil, meats, a large board, chairs and a griddle.  She started her business five years ago.  Her mother had the same kind of business and she taught her how to make tortillas by hand and to cook.  Her business is important because she likes to sell and she has work.  She feels proud that she knows how to make hand-made tortillas.  Her customers are neighbors, students and field hands.  She tends to them well and prepares snacks with love so that they will taste good and customers will return.  She’s planning on buying a large board, tables and chairs and intends to do so with the loan.

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “We are grateful for the loans.  You think about people of few resources and help us get ahead with our businesses.  Thank you for trusting us.”

loans.use: Compra de maiz, manteca, aceite, carnes, un tablon, un comal y sillas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jewelry, shoes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Las Palmyx Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las palmix esta conformado por trece integrantes todas mujeres trabajadoras  humildes y buenas madres ya que trabajan para ofrecerle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
Sus integrantes decidieron ponerle las Palmix a su grupo ya que donde se reúnen para sus juntas  esta lleno de palmas de flores.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maribel  Elvia  quien se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa de segunda .
Doña Maribel Elvia nos cuenta que se ha dedicado su negocio desde hace cuatro años  que lo que mas le gusta es vender calzado ya que es lo que le deja mas ganancias y sus clientes les gusta el trato que les da  y la calidad de su mercancía.
Doña Maribel esta felizmente casada con el señor Alfonso Joel con quien tiene  dos hijos Jenifer  y Juan Luis quienes le ayudan en su negocio  ya que atiende a los clientes cuando van a comparar ropa a su casa.
Uno de los sueños de Doña Maribel es hacer mas grande su negocio tener un  local donde pueda exhibir su mercancía.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de ropa y calzado para la venta
Doña Maribel  dice que le gustaría  mucho vender  perfumes de la marca Mary Key.
Las integrantes del grupo son:
Julia- quien se dedica a la venta de pollo.
Irenea- quien se dedica a la  venta de ganado.
Caritita Atilana- quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Gloria- quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Zaida- quien se dedica a la venta de carnes  frías.
Eva- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosalba- quien se dedica a la venta de  productos de belleza y servicios de estilista.
María de los Ángeles- quien se dedica a la venta de bisutería.
Tomasa- quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Elvira Marlen- quien se dedica a la venta de carnes frías.
María Guadalupe- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Guadalupe- quien se dedica a la venta de carnes frías.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por tenderle las manos y ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
This group is called “Palmix” and it has 13 members, all hardworking, humble women who are good mothers because they work to provide the best for their children.  They decided to name it Palmix because the place where the meet is full of flowering palm trees.

One of the group members is Maribel Elvia who sells second-hand clothes and footwear.  Maribel tells us that she’s been in this business for four years and what she most enjoys is selling footwear because that’s what produces the highest profits and her customers enjoy the treatment she gives them and the quality of her merchandise.

Maribel is happily married to Alfonso Joel with whom she has two children: Jenifer and Juan Luis who help her with the business since they take care of customers when the visit her house to buy clothes.  One of Maribel’s dreams is to enlarge the business and have a locale where she can display her merchandise.  She asked for the loan to buy clothes and footwear to sell.  Maribel says that she’d very much like to sell Mary Kay perfumes.

The group members are:

Julia- sells chicken.
Irenea- sells livestock.
Caritita Atilana- sells shoes.
Gloria- sells groceries.
Zaida- sells cold cuts.
Eva- sells traditional Mexican fast food snacks.
Rosalba- is a hair stylist and sells beauty products.
María de los Ángeles- sells costume jewelry.
Tomasa- sells groceries.
Elvira Marlen- sells cold cuts.
María Guadalupe- sells traditional Mexican fast food snacks.
Guadalupe- sells cold cuts.

They thank the Fundación for extending them a helping hand and helping people who need it.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Khadim

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a quitté très tôt l'école.Il devait travailler pour soutenir ses deux parents dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille. Il se lance alors dans le commerce de cartes de téléphone prépayées qui se vendent très bien dans sa localité. Pour écouler ses cartes, il se déplace dans les grandes artères de la ville en les proposant aux passants. Ce travail très difficile lui permet néanmoins de subvenir à ses besoins et de supporter l'essentiel des dépenses de sa famille. Il sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter  un stock de cartes téléphoniques et faire face ainsi à la forte demande en cette veille de fêtes de fin d'année. Son ambition est de louer une cantine à la gare routière de sa ville.
texts.en:
The borrower is a youth who left school very early. He needed to work to support his two parents in taking care of the needs of the family. 

So he began selling prepaid phone cards which sell very well in his region. To sell off his cards, he goes to the main roads of the town and offers them to passersby. This very difficult job allows him nevertheless to meet his needs and to support the essential expenses of his family. 

He is requesting a loan of 250,000f to buy a stock of phone cards and be ready for the large demand this eve of the festive season. His goal is to rent a canteen at the bus station of his town.

loans.use: to buy a stock of phone cards.

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los mangos  esta conformado por diez integrantes todas mujeres trabajadoras con ganas de salir adelante y  ofrecerles una mejor vida a sus  familias.
Las integrantes de este grupo  nos cuenta que sus vidas van mejorando gracias al apoyo que les ha dado fundación realidad  ya que sus negocios crecen cada día mas.
Una de las integrantes  es la señora Elsa Maribel  de treinta seis años de edad una señora trabajadora y humilde que se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años, ella  nos cuenta que gracias al apoyo de dios a podido salir adelante con su negocio ya que le deja buenas ganancias.
Doña Mari como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  esta felizmente casada con la señor Miguel un señor trabajador quien se dedica a la siembra de maíz  y ajonjolí.
Ella  pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa para la venta de  niños y de dama  y hacer pedidos de uniformes escolares.
Las otras integrantes del grupo  son:
Carmela – quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Minerva- quien se dedica a la venta de manualidades.
Erica – quien se dedica a la venta de postres.
Fortunata  Teresa- quien se dedica a la venta de masa,nixtamal y tortillas.
Ausencia- quien se dedica a la venta de materiales para la construccion.
Edith- quien se dedica a la venta ropa.
Teresa- quien se dedica a la venta de postres.
Anayeli- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Hortencia- quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por todo el apoyo que le han dado para seguir con sus negocios y triunfar en la vida  y aumentar empleos en  sus localidades.
texts.en:
This group is called The Mangos and has ten members who are all working women who want to get ahead and offer their families a better life.

The members of this group tell us their lives are improving thanks to the help that the foundation has given them, honestly, because their business are growing every day.

One of the members is Elsa Maribel who is 36 years old. She is a humble working woman who has been selling clothing for the last three years. She tells us that thanks to the help of God she could succeed in business and that it left her with good profits. Doña Mari, as she is called by the members of the group, is happily married to Miguel, a worker who grows corn and sesame. She asked for a loan to buy more clothing for children and ladies and has orders for school uniforms.

The other members of the group are:

Carmela who is dedicated to the sale of Mexican snacks
Minerva who is dedicated to the sale of handicrafts
Erica who is dedicated to the sale of desserts
Fortunata Teresa who is dedicated to the sale of flour, corn and tortillas
Ausencia who is dedicated to the sale of construction materials
Edith who is dedicated to the sale of clothing
Teresa who is dedicated to the sale of desserts
Anayeli who is dedicated to the sale of clothing
Hortencia who is dedicated to the sale of fish

They give thanks to the foundation for all the help that they have given so they can continue in their businesses and triumph in life and expand employment in their towns.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: De Peddlers Group

texts.en:
Kadie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadie was born in the village of Rosinte about 37 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has five children – two in primary school and two in secondary. Kadie sells firewood, oranges, cassavas, etc. Kadie has been doing business for many years now.
 
With the help of this loan, Kadie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadie will use her share of the loan (400,000 SLL) to buy firewood and oranges in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and oranges in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Marisol Rosario

texts.es:
Marisol es una joven emprendedora de 21 años, natural de San Vicente de Cañete, conocido popularmente como Cañete, Perú. Ubicado alrededor de una hora y media al sur de Lima, Cañete, con sus playas de arena, ruinas pre-incas, y la producción del adorado nacional licor de Perú, el Pisco (una especie de aguardiente de uva), ha sido durante mucho tiempo un destino turístico para los peruanos adinerados. Pero la verdadera Cañete es una ciudad cálida y tranquila con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un camino indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante el 2001 y 2007 terremotos Perú, pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia, nuestra cliente vive en esta ciudad, en casa de sus tíos, a los cuales apoya con los frutos de su trabajo.

Marisol es una mujer muy empeñosa y responsable, ella tiene una amplia experiencia en el negocio de venta y reparaciones de equipos celulares desde hace 4 años, tuvo la iniciativa de incursionar en este negocio ya que veía en ella esta habilidad, y también se encontró influenciada por la gran acogida que tienen estos productos en los pobladores de su comunidad. Marisoltiene una gran cantidad de clientes gracias a la amabilidad que brinda en la atención a sus clientes y también por la calidad de los productos que ofrece. Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla y así compré más celulares modernos y pueda ofrecer una mayor variedad de los mismos, esta iniciativa le permitirá incrementar aún más la venta de sus productos. Esta nueva idea de negocio le permitirá seguir confiando en cumplir su sueño de "Tener más locales donde vender celulares"
texts.en:
Marisol, 21, is a young entrepreneur from San Vicente de Cañete, known as Cañete, Perú. Cañete is located 1.5 hours away from Lima and due to its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins and production of Peru’s favorite spirit, Pisco (a sort of grape distilled drink), has for a long time been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. The real Cañete, though, is a warm and calm city with a large Afro-Peruvian population, the remains of an indigenous path and the influence of the Spanish Empire. Along with many others in Perú, this city was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 earthquakes but it has survived as always. Our client lives in this city with her aunt and uncle, who are supported by her work. 

Marisol is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman with a broad experience in selling and repairing cell phones. She had the idea to start this business 4 years ago because she felt she had the skills for it and saw the demand potential in her community. She has a large number of customers because of her kindness when dealing with them and the quality of her products. Currently she’d like Kiva loaners to help her so she can purchase more modern phones, thus offering a wider variety to her clients. This initiative will allow her to further increase her sales and will also allow her to remain confident in her dream of “having more stores for selling cell phones.”

loans.use: to purchase cell phones for selling them

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme mariée, père de deux filles. Il est employée comme conducteur de motocyclette de transport urbain depuis près de deux ans. Il arrive difficilement à "joindre les deux bouts" avec son salaire. Pour obtenir assez de revenus et bien entretenir sa famille, il a veut acheter sa propre moto et sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f auprès de l'UIMCEC.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man, father to two girls. He has been employed as a motorcycle driver for urban transport for almost two years.

He has difficulty making ends meet with his salary. To obtain enough income and support his family well, he wants to buy his own motorcycle and thus is requesting a loan of 400,000f from the UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Iván, de 25 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y servicial. Convive con Diana quien es ama de casa. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su padre, madre, pareja y su hijo de 2 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Iván es la agricultura para eso cuenta con un terreno de 9 hectáreas de extensión, pero solo con 2 y ½ de hectárea de papaya en producción. Tiene 12 años realizando esta actividad y actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de 5 peones a quien paga por día trabajado 20 nuevos soles. Él saca su producto a la venta a los mercados de la capital contando con una gran demanda del producto. Le gusta la vida de campo pues se siente cómodo, ya que aprendió de sus padres, y escogió éste oficio por la buena rentabilidad que tiene debido la demanda de este producto. Por lo contario, comenta que le incomoda el clima caluroso, pues lo fatiga bastante al realizar los trabajos de campo. Pero sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación se sale adelante y se consigue lo que se desea, y viendo la buena rentabilidad que tiene desea ampliar la extensión de sus sembrios de papaya. Por otro lado espera terminar sus estudios de operador de maquinaria pesada. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, está contenta de contar con una línea de crediticia para avanzar con su actividad, por eso se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá comprando más semillas de papaya, asimismo contratará peones para que lo ayuden en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ivan, who is 25 years old, is a hard-working and obliging man. He lives with his partner Diana, who is a housewife. Together they live in their own house along with his father, his mother, and their son, who is two years old. Ivan's work is agriculture. He has a 9-hectare plot of land but with only 2 1/2 hectares of papaya in production. He has been doing this work for 12 years, and now he has the help of five workers, whom he pays 20 PEN for a day of work. He takes his products to sell at the markets in the capital, counting on the great demand for this product. He likes life in the country, since he feels comfortable there and since he learned this work from his parents and chose it for its good profitability, which it has thanks to the demand for this product. In contrast, he comments that the hot climate bothers him, since it makes him quite tired to do the work in the field. But he knows that with effort and dedication he will advance and achieve what he wants, and seeing the good profitability that it has, he wants to increase the extent of his papaya plantings. On the other hand, he hopes to finish his studies in operating heavy machinery. 

This will be his second loan with the MFP institution. He is happy to have a line of credit to advance with his work. For this reason he promises to make his payments. He will invest the 1500 PEN that he has applied for in buying more papaya seeds, as well as hiring workers to help him maintain his plantings.

loans.use: to buy papaya seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies for his roasted chicken business

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en: Saffie (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 52 years ago in Makeni city, Saffie is married and has five children.  For 27 years now, Saffie has been a businesswoman. Currently, Saffie sells market food: palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice, tomatoes, etc. Saffie is going to use her share of the loan (1,000,000 SLL) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, rice, tomatoes, etc.in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr:
Madame Nogoye est une femme âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 02 autres enfants qui lui confiés par des proche. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007 et appartient au groupe de Solidarité de Mame Diarra.

Elle développe un petit comme de légume. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 300.000 francs CFA elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en légumes (carottes, choux, oignons etc.) pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Ms. Nogoye is a 63-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. She also has two additional children left in her care by close relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village loan group) since 22 October 2007 and belongs to the solidarity group of Mame Diarra.

She has developed a small business selling vegetables. She has gained lots of experience in this field of business, having practiced it for several years.

With her new loan of 300,000 francs CFA, she is going to increase her supplies of vegetables (carrots, cabbage, onions, etc.) to better satisfy her customers.

Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the family and, at the same time, increase her level of savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Honest Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Honest” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is 28 years old and married with four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells market food and has been doing this business for 18 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy palm oil, salt, pepper, rice, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, salt, pepper, rice, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: A sus 29 años, la señora Diana Patricia es madre cabeza de hogar, quien vela por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos y sus padres por quienes tiene la necesidad de trabajar para poder brindarles alimentación y vivienda puesto que no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie más. La señora Diana Patricia ha vivido toda su vida en el campo y actualmente necesita de la compra de pollos de engorde y cuido con el ánimo de iniciar su propio negocio y así poder cumplir con sus obligaciones y sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Diana Patricia, 29, is a mother and head of the household.  She watches over the well-being of her three children and her parents, for whom she needs to work to be able to give them nourishment and shelter since they do not have the support of anyone else.  Diana Patricia has lived her whole life in the country and currently she needs to buy chickens for fattening and feed, with the goal of starting her own business and so be able to fulfill her obligations and support her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Agnes Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Agnes” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kaday, on the left, is the leader of this group. The 57-year-old widow has five children – two in secondary school and one in college. Kaday has been a businesswoman for more than eight years now. She sells soft and hard drinks. She also sells sugar, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy drinks in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to  buy drinks in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou est une femme âgée de 64 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de huit enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis 25 octobre 2008. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité Takku ligguey.

Elle fait un commerce de détail par la vente de tissus et chaussures en provenance de la sous région. En sus elle fabrique de la glace qu'elle son quartier. 

Son nouveau crédit de 440.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement dans le but de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus financiers

Elle a comme objectif de prendre en charge la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 64-year-old widow with eight children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village group fund) since 25 October 2008. She belongs to the Takku Ligguey solidarity group.

She runs a retail business selling fabric and shoes from the region. In addition, she makes ice cream that she sells in her neighbourhood.

Her new loan of 440,000 francs CFA will allow her to increase her supplies, with the goal of better satisfying her clientele and increasing her income.

Her goal is to take care of her children's nutrition and health needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric and shoes, and to make and sell ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
Sokhna est une femme âgée 35 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois 27 octobre 2008. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité "TAKKU LIGUEYE"

Elle est coiffeuse de profession. Dans son salon de coiffure elle compte développer un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques. En sus elle fabrique des perruques qu'elle exporter vers l'étranger. 

Avec son nouveau crédit de 275.000 francs cfa elle va renforcer son activité en achetant plus de produits cosmétiques et de mèches pour la fabrication de ses perruques.

Son objectif est d'agrandir son petit commerce afin de toucher le plus grand nombre de clients. Ses profits lui permettront de prendre en charge son fils et d'augmenter ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Sokhna is a 35-year old woman. She is divorced and has one child, who is in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (village group fund) since 27 October 2008. She belongs to the "Takku Ligueye" solidarity group.

She is a hairstylist by profession. At her hair salon, she intends to develop a small business selling cosmetics. In addition, she makes wigs that she exports abroad.

With her new loan of 275,000 francs CFA, she is going to the strengthen her business by buying more cosmetics and hair extensions to make her wigs.

Her goal is to expand her small business in order to reach more clients. Her profits will allow her to take care of her son and increase her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Temtemneh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Temtemneh” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 1,400,000.00 SLL, for each, in order to invest in their businesses. 

John is the leader of this group. John is forty-three-years-old. He is married and has four children who are attending schools. John sells used clothes, cotton cloth, gara cloths, etc. He has been a businessman for more than twenty years now. With his share of this loan, John is going to buy clothes and cloth in larger quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes/cloths in larger quantity to add to his business.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa est une femme âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité "BOK JOM"

Elle fait du petit commerce de tissus et de parfums. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir menée depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs cfa elle va renforcer son activité de vente de tissus et parfums pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de renforcer ses revenus financiers et de participer à la prise en charge de son fils.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village fund group) since 22 October 2007. She belongs to the "Bok Jom" solidarity group.

She runs a small business selling fabric and perfume. She has gained lots of experience in this field, having run this business for several years.

With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to strengthen her fabric- and perfume-selling business in order to better satisfy her clientele.

Her goal is to increase her income and contribute to the care of her son.

loans.use: To buy fabric and perfume.

loans.name: Lavi Miyo De Savann Okan Group

texts.fr:
Marie  est la coordinatrice de son groupe lavi miyo

Elle n'est pas marié et elle a 7 enfants.
