Marie habite dans la région de savanne aux camps nord `est d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Marie a dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant les dernières 6 années.

 Avant de commencer ce commerce Marie était une venduse de poisson.

Marie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans des vente des produits divers. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de Lavi miyo ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques.

Marie dit que son rêve  est obtenir une epicerie.
texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of the group Lavi Miyo. She is not married and has seven children. Marie lives in the savannah region in the northeastern camps of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce.

Marie has managed her business selling a variety of products for the last six years. Before beginning this business Marie was a fish seller.

Marie would like to use this loan to invest in the sale of diverse products. She hopes that this loan will help her to obtain a bigger business. Other members of Lavi Miyo need a loan for businesses such as the sale of food products and cosmetics. Marie says that her dream is to have a grocer's shop.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (shoes, cosmetics, etc.).

loans.name: David S.'s Group

texts.en:
This are a group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lender to seek for a loan of 3,000,000 SLL (US$700) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. Gradually, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Pictured in the right is David, the leader of this group. The fifty-eight year old is a native of Mamunta village in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a nurse and the couple has seven children, two are in primary school, one is in secondary school and the other is in college. David has served in the teaching profession for thirty-six years now. He is going to use this loan in order to pay college fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his child.

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr:
Madame Khoudia est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de produits de mercerie. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années. 

Son nouveau crédit de 450.000 francs cfa lui permettra de renforcer son activité par l'augmentation de son niveau d'approvisionnement en produits de mercerie. 

Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité de petit commerce lui permettront d'acheter une machine à coudre et également d'épargner suffisamment au niveau du Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Ms. Khoudia is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village fund) since 22 October 2007.

She has developed a small business selling cloth and dressmaking supplies. She has gained lots of experience in this field, having run her business for several years.

Her new loan of 450,000 francs CFA will allow her to strengthen her business by increasing her supplies of haberdashery items.

The profits realized from her small business will allow her to buy a sewing machine and also build up sufficient savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy cloth and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Faty Arele

texts.fr:
Faty Arèle est une femme de 44 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 14 mai 2010. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité "BOKK JOM"

Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus, de lait caillé et de "thiakri" (couscous au lait). Elle a une bonne dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau crédit de 350.000 francs cfa elle va développer son activité en renforçant son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises (tissus, lait et "thiakri" pour satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif de prendre en charge les besoins scolaires et sanitaires de ses deux enfants tout en renforçant ses épargnes dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en: Faty Arèle is a 44 year old woman. She is divorced and mother of two dependent children. She has been a member of the Villageois Bank since May 14, 2010.  She is a member of the BOKK JOM  solidarity group. She runs a small business selling fabric, curdled milk and "thiakri" (coucous with milk).  She is doing well since she has been in business for many years. With her new loan of 350,000 francs, she will develop her business by increasing her supply of goods (fabric, milk, and "thiakri") to satisfy her customers.  Her goal is to take care of the educational and health needs of her two children while building her savings at the Villageois Bank.

loans.use: to buy fabric, curdled milk and "thiakri".

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hardware products.

loans.name: Sopey Xaleyi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sopey Xaleyi a été crée le 12 Mai 2010, Il est composé de 14 femmes issue de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Ndèye (Debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait la transformation de l'huile d'arachide. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement acheter un mouton et des arachides pour revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: The Sopey Xaleyi solidarity group was created on May 12, 2010. It consists of 14 women who are all from the same area.  They are all in the business of processing peanut oil.  Ndeye (standing at the right of the photo) is the manager of the group.  She is 51 years old.  She is married and mother of 10 children.  She processes peanut oil.  With her loan, she will increase her inventory and buy a sheep and peanuts for resale.  Her profits will allow her to support her husband by taking care of the family expenses and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Jubbo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité  JUBBO a été créé le 12 Mai 2010. Il est composé de 13 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité: la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Fatou (Debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle fait la transformation de l'huile d'arachide. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement acheter un mouton et des arachides pour revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en: The JUBBO solidarity group was created on May 12, 2010. It consists of 13 women from the same area.  They are in the same business of processing of peanut oil.  Fatou (standing at the right of the photo) is the manager of the group.  She is 31 years old. She is married with 8 children. She processes peanut oil.  With her loan, she will increase her inventory, buy a sheep and peanuts for resale.  Her profits will allow her to help her husband take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and peanuts.

loans.name: Parque El Litre Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Parque El Litre” está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican principalmente al rubro del comercio en diferentes ferias libres. Entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa para varón, chocolatería, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
María Angelica tesorera del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en una silla en primera fila, en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, usa una polera color sandía y sostiene a su pequeña hija en las piernas.
Se dedica a vender ropa usada para varón y dama, además ropa nueva para bebé y durante época de navidad vende juguetes. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 2 años.
Instala su puesto de ropa en diferentes ferias libres dos veces a la semana, el resto de los días ofrece y vende la mercadería desde su casa. Además está esperando un permiso municipal, para trabajar los días domingos. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras ubicadas en la ciudad de Santiago y Valparaíso. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva para bebé, además de artículos para la Fiesta de Año Nuevo, entre cotillón y challa. 
Las metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido para ofrecer su mercadería, de una manera menos esforzada, ya que durante las temporadas de invierno y verano, se ve afectada por la lluvia y el sol.
María Angelica vive junto a su madre, su hermana y su hija de 2 años de edad. En la actualidad a su madre la aqueja una compleja enfermedad (tumor cervical), situación que la mantiene con dificultades para trasladarse por sí sola. Por lo que uno de sus sueños es que su madre se recupere, para esto María Angelica hace todo lo posible para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y por ende una mayor comodidad. Otro de sus sueños es obtener su vivienda propia, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional, por lo que su familia ha debido tener paciencia para esperar el llamado de entrega.
Por esto igual la motivación de continuar con su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que ha hecho amistades y que a pesar de algunos inconvenientes, han sabido superarlos.
Por otro lado tiene buenas expectativas respecto a las capacitaciones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Parque El Litre” ["El Litre Park"] and is comprised of 20 entrepreneurs who, for the most part, are merchants at various open markets. Among them, you will find individuals who sell men's clothing and chocolate, as well as other businesses. They are all from the city of Valparaíso.

María Angelica is the treasurer of this communal bank. In the photo, she is seated in the first row of chairs, second from the right. She is wearing a watermelon-colored shirt and has her young daughter on her lap. She sells used clothing for men and women, as well as new clothing for babies. During the Christmas season she also sells toys. She has been working in this business for two years.

María Angelica sets up her clothing stand in different open markets twice a week and sells merchandise from her home on the other days. She is also awaiting a municipal permit to work on Sundays. She buys her merchandise from distributors located in the cities of Santiago and Valparaíso.

She will use this loan to buy new clothing for babies, as well as items for New Year's celebrations, such as party supplies and shawls. Her goal for her business is to have an established location so that she can offer her merchandise more easily, since during the winter and summer seasons she is currently affected by the rain and sun.

María Angelica lives with her mother, her sister, and her two year-old daughter. Her mother is currently suffering from a complex illness (a cervical tumor), which makes it hard for her to get around by herself. Another of María Angelica's dreams is for her mother to recover, so she is doing everything she can to offer her mother more comfort and a better quality of life. María Angelica also dreams of owning her own property, so she has already applied for a housing subsidy. Her family has had to have patience as they wait for the approval call. This has further motivated María Angelica to continue with her business.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business. In respect to her communal bank, María Angelica comments that she has formed friendships and that despite some drawbacks, they have been able to succeed. She also has high expectations for the educational training sessions.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also the legislative seat of the country. It is the country's main port and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque sites, such as the home of Nobel Prize winning poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy new baby clothing, as well as items for the New Year's celebration, including party supplies and shawls

loans.name: Lamour Du Prochain De Ferrier Group

texts.fr:
Ezechiel est le coordinatrice de son groupe LAMOURDU PROCHAIN DE FERRIER

Il n´est pas mariee. Il n'a pas d'enfants. Ezechiel  habite dans la région de  FERRIER d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité il a dirigé son  commerce de vetement pendant les 7  dernières  années.

Ezechiel  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avenduit du Vetement.

Ezechiel espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness. Il  dit que ses défis principal est de venie un grand commercant
texts.en:
Ezechiel is the coordinator of his group Lamourdu Prochain de Ferrier. He is not married. He has no children. Ezechiel lives in the Ferrier region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce.

He has been managing his business selling clothing for the past 7 years.

Ezechiel would like to use this loan to invest in clothing products. Ezechiel hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. He says that his main challenge is to become a great shopkeeper.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Arnovi De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Arnovi trabaja como mayordomo en una finca de una vereda del municipio del Retiro ubicado al norte de Antioquia, en su lugar de trabajo y gracias a su excelente desempeño, le brindaron la oportunidad de tener su propio ganado y es por esto que requiere de la compra de dos terneras con las cuales pueda aprovechar e iniciar su negocio, con lo cual pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa e hija de tres años y por quienes vela y responde económicamente. El sueño del señor Arnovi es tener bien consolidado su negocio y brindarle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Sr. Arnovi works as a foreman on a farm in a district in the township of Retiro, located north of Antioquia. Thanks to his excellent performance, he was offered the opportunity to have his own cattle at his place of work. Consequently, he needs to buy two calves so he can take advantage of the situation and start his own business. This would enable him to improve the quality of life of his wife and 3 year old daughter, who are dependent upon him.

Arnovi’s dream is to see his business well established so that he can provide his daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green and ripe plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products like basic grains, canned goods and soft drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Blanca Lucila

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora y honrada, ella tiene 33 años de edad es casada, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad, vive con su familia en Ibarra Provincia de Imbabura en el Norte de Ecuador.

Blanca trabaja sola en la crianza de animales (cerdos blancos), se dedicó a este negocio ya que vió la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2007, el actual crédito es para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos para su crianza, debido a que incrementaría su negocio y podría tener buenos ingresos en la temporada de diciembre.

El sueño de Blanca es poder construir chancheras para cuidar mejor a sus animales e incrementar su nivel económico.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very honest, respectable, hard-working woman. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are 12 and 9 years old. She lives with her family in Ibarra, which is in Imbabura Province in northern Ecuador. 

Blanca works alone raising animals (white pigs). She got into this business because she saw she needed to help her husband cover the household expenses. She has been working with Fodemi since 2007, and the current loan is for buying white piglets to raise. This would allow her to expand her business and have better earnings in the month of December.

Blanca's dream is to build pig pens so she can better care for her animals and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy white piglets for her to raise because demand for them is high in December.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bundle of used bras and used children's clothing.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El Banco Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, está conformado por 9 integrantes en el cual todas son mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras que buscan el bienestar de ellas y de su familia. Este grupo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en el cual han sido excelente clientas y ellas nos explican que gracias al apoyo que les han brindado con el financiamiento ha incrementado su inversión y su clientela ofreciéndoles variedad de producto a sus clientes. Mireira de Carmen es una emprendedora que se ha unido a este grupo para salir adelante y apoyarse entre ellas mismas, su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general lo cual también tiene venta de ropa usada, actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros, zapatos, cosméticos entre otros productos que le están demandando su clientela.
texts.en:
The "Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe" communal bank is made up of nine members. All of them are enterprising and determined women, who are seeking their own well-being and that of their families.

This group has already had a loan with Fundación León 2000. They have been excellent clients, and they tell us that thanks to the support given them with the loan, they have increased their investment and their clientele, by offering their customers a variety of products. 

Mireira de Carmen is an entrepreneur who has brought this group together, so that they can move forward and support one another. Her business is selling general merchandise, including used clothing. 

Currently, she is applying for a loan to invest in her business, through the purchase of ladies' and men's clothing, shoes, and cosmetics, and other products that her clientele are asking for.

loans.use: To buy ladies' and men's clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La señora Luz Maria a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina e infantil, con los frutos de esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos puesto que no cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge del cual se separo hace dos años. Con el fin de mejorar en cuanto a su calidad de vida y bienestar de sus hijos, desea adquirir surtido con el cual pueda recuperar su clientela, mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir su sueño algún día de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 47, and sells women's and children's clothing. With the proceeds of this business, she has been able to raise her two children, as she doesn't have the support of her partner, from whom she separated two years ago.

With the aim of improving her quality of life, and the well-being of her children, she wishes to acquire stock with which she can win customers, improve her income, and fulfil her dream of having her own store one day.

loans.use: To buy a selection of women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter and other products.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
María, es comerciante, vive con sus padres y hermanos, ella tiene 24 años de edad, está soltera, se dedica a vender ropa y juguetes, sombrillas, entre otra mercadería, lleva tres años en el negocio, trabajando de lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, blusas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, para surtir el negocio, además comprara juguetes plásticos para niños y niñas, esperando incrementar la mercadería y las ventas.
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a sus padres en las necesidades.
texts.en:
María is a small business owner. She is 24, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. She sells clothing, toys, umbrellas, and other merchandise. 

She has been in business for three years, working Monday to Saturday. She is applying for a loan in order to buy articles of clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirts, and dresses for stocking her business. In addition she will buy plastic toys for little girls and boys, hoping to increase merchandise and sales. 

Her objective is to strengthen the business, to have a better quality of life, and to support her parents with the necessities of life.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, shirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 46 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, además de amable y alegre. Convive con Luzlinda quien es comerciante. Juntos habitan en su propia casa en compañía de su hijo de 6 años. La actividad que desempeña Teofilo es la agricultura tiene un terreno de 53 hectáreas de extensión, la cual compró hace 12 años, ahí siembra productos como maíz y plátanos, siendo su producto principal la yuca, ya que esa zona es propicia para éste producto. Luego lo vende a los mercados locales, teniendo bastante demanda, por eso para las labores de cosecha contrata a 2 peones a los que paga por día de trabajo 20 nuevos soles cada uno. Le gusta la agricultura, inicialmente se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio ya que comenta que de joven tuvo muchas dificultades de conseguir trabajo, pues no completó sus estudio segundarios. En la actualidad se siente conforme con su vida en el campo ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le permite llevar una vida tranquila y con muchos planes como por ejemplo tiene planes de incursionar en el sembrío de palma aceitera ya que éste producto está en auge y tiene bastante demanda. Asimismo desea montar una tienda de abarrotes para que peuda atender su pareja y así tener una estabilidad económica. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido con la ayuda financiera para avanzar con sus planes.  Además de estar muy cómodo con su banco comunal ya que conoce a sus miembros y los considera ser personas amables y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para un bodega que desea iniciar en su casa ubicada en su caserío donde atendería su pareja.
texts.en: Teofilo is a 46 year old, driven, hardworking, friendly, and cheerful man. He lives with Luzlinda who is a storekeeper. Together they live in their own home along with their six-year-old son. Teofilo is a farm worker and has 53 hectares of land which he bought 12 years ago. There he grows corn, bananas, and his main product, yuca, since the area favors its growth. He then sells his products in local markets where he has a high demand. He hired two farmers he pays 20 Peruvian soles daily to meet these high demands. He enjoys farming. In the beginning, he became a farmer for his need to find a job since he had difficulty finding one in his youth for not graduating from junior high school. At the moment, he feels happy with his life in the fields since it has brought him much satisfaction and allows them to have a tranquil life with many plans. Such plans include growing palm trees for palm oil since this product has a high demand. He would also like to have a grocery store for his partner to have a stable business. This will be his fourth loan with the MFP institution. He is thankful for the financial support offered to help advance his plans. He is also very comfortable with his communal bank since he knows the members and he considers them to be friendly and responsible people. With the 2000 Peruvian soles loan he plans to buy groceries for the store he plans to start in his home to be attended by his wife.

loans.use: buy a variety of products to build a grocery store.

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es: A sus 25 años, el señor Francisco se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, actividad heredada de sus padres puesto que toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo. Gracias a esta labor puede conseguir el sustento para él y su esposa quienes sueñan con tener dos hijos. Con el ánimo de buscar una mejora en la economía de su hogar, el señor Francisco desea adquirir una vaca lechera con la cual pueda producir leche y venderla a sus vecinos y familiares, con lo anterior podrá conseguir los ingresos necesarios para vivir con su esposa y ahorrar para sus futuros hijos.
texts.en: At 25 years old, Francisco is working in agriculture and raising cattle. He inherited this work from his parents, having spent his entire life in the fields. Thanks to this work he has been able to sustain himself and his wife. They dream of having two children together. With the aim of improving their household economy, Francisco would like to acquire a dairy cow so that he can produce milk to sell to his neighbors and relatives. This will make it possible for him to obtain the income he and his wife need to live off of and to save for their future children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La   señora  Guadalupe  es  una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable que  día  con día  se preocupa por el bienestar  de su  familia es por  ello  que  en esta  ocasión requiere   de  nuestra ayuda  para  realizar  su proyecto, el cual  consiste  en realizar  la construcción de una  barda  en  su  domicilio , ya  que  comenta  que  actualmente   ya   tiene   material de  construcción,  pero  requiere   adquirir  cemento  para  concluir  con su sueño,  ve  en el crédito la oportunidad  de  brindar  a  su  familia una mayor  seguridad es por ello  que  agradece  el apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Ms. Guadalupe is a hard-working and responsible woman who concerns herself with the well-being of her family day in and day out. That is why she needs our help at this time in order to complete her project, which consists of building a wall at her home. Guadalupe explains that she already has construction materials but needs to acquire cement in order to complete her dream. In this loan, she sees the opportunity to offer her family greater security. She is grateful to be offered the support needed to complete her project.

loans.use: to build a wall to improve her home's security

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: La señora Yanet a sus 34 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad,  gracias al negocio que tiene desde el año 2006 en el cual vende mercancía, minutos, alimentos y bebidas ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Con el propósito de mejorar la variedad de los productos ofrecidos en su negocio, la señora Yanet requiere de la compra de surtido con el cual incentive sus ventas y las mejore puesto que el invierno ha afectado sus ingresos. El sueño de la señora Yanet es poder brindarle a sus hijos educación y tener su propia casa.
texts.en: Ms. Yanet is 34 years old and the mother of two children, ages 17 and 10. Thanks to the business she has had since 2006 - where she sells merchandise, cell phone minutes, groceries, and beverages - she has managed to get her family ahead. The winter has affected her profits, so with the goal of improving the variety of products offered in her store, Yanet needs to purchase an assortment of products to encourage and improve sales. Yanet's dream is to be able to offer her children an education and to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a variety of soft drinks, snacks, and sweets

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” está conformado por 09 socios entre hombres y mujeres, que llevan trabajando 16 meses con el Programa- Prosperidad. La Sra. María es la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad, ella tiene 55 años de edad es  casada y tiene 03 hijos independientes, actualmente María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, la cual trabaja sobe pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos, también ofrece servicios de limpieza y cocina de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. María es una mujer empeñosa que con su trabajo ha ayudado a cubrir los gastos familiares. Con el deseo de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito, ya que lo piensa usar como capital de trabajo comprando talcos, colonias y cremas y de esta manera tener un stock guardado. El deseo de María es de instalar una pastelería, pues una de sus hijas sabe de repostería. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The “Las Talentosas” ["The Talented Ones"] Communal Bank is comprised of nine members, both men and women, who have been working with the Prosperidad ["Prosperity"] Program for 16 months. Ms. María is the group treasurer, a role she fulfills responsibly. She is 55 years old, married, and has three grown children. María sells beauty products by taking orders from acquaintances. She also offers cleaning and cooking services in order to earn more income for her household. María is a very hard-working woman who, through her work, has helped to cover her family's expenses. With the desire to continue improving, she is requesting a loan that she plans to use to purchase powders, colognes, and creams. This way, she can have stock on hand. María's dream is to open a pastry shop, as one of her daughters knows pastry-making.

Las Talentosas Communal Bank is grateful to be offered this loan.

loans.use: to buy powders, colognes, and creams

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge, es una persona trabajadora y responsable el  cual  tiene   una  tienda  abarrotes  la  cual  le  permite  salir  adelante  día con  día,  gracias  a  su esfuerzo  diario  ahora  tiene   su  casa  el  cual  representa  su  patrimonio  familiar,  el  requiere   de nuestro  apoyo  ya  que  necesita  impermeabilizar la  losa  de  su domicilio  ya  que  desea  mantenerla  protegida en  esta  temporada  de  lluvia, ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  brindar  a su  familia  una  mayor  seguridad agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Jorge is a hard-working and responsible person who has a grocery store that allows him to get ahead day by day.  Thanks to his daily effort he now has his house, which represents his family legacy.  He needs our help because he needs to waterproof the slab of his home, since he wants to protect it in this rainy season.  He sees in the loan the possibility of giving his family greater security.  He is grateful for the support offered to realize his project.

loans.use: to waterproof his concrete slab.

loans.name: Ondina Francisca

texts.es:
Ondina reside en la colonia Dionisio en el municipio de Olanchito en el departamento de Yoro, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hija de 6 años quien cursa el primer año en la escuela. 

Ondina tiene una venta de ropa usada que atiende todos los dias desde temprano por las mañanas hasta que cae la tarde y las ventas las realiza en su casa de habitacion y tambien de forma ambulante cuando su hija esta en la escuela. Ondina es una persona muy conocida en la colonia y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos; se esfuerza mucho en hacer su trabajo bien.

Ella solicita este prestamo para poder comprar varios fardos de ropa especialmente estilos a la moda para esta epoca navideña para que sus clientes y clientas encuentren lo que necesiten para estar siempre bellos y bellas. Este prestamo sera de mucho beneficio para ella y su hija, ya que con las ganancias que obtenga podra seguir sosteniendose. Ella sueña con tener su propia tienda. Es su primer prestamo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Ondina lives in the Dionisio community in the town of Olanchito in the department of Yoro.  She is 28 years old and a single mother, and lives with her 6-year-old daughter who is in the first year of school.

Ondina has a used-clothing business that she tends every day from early in the morning until the afternoon.  She makes her sales in her home and also on foot when her daughter is in school.  Ondina is a well-known person in the community and has very good references from her customers and neighbors.  She works hard to do her work well.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various bundles of clothing, especially fashions in style this Christmas season so her customers and clients find what they need to always be handsome and beautiful.  This loan will be a big help to her and her daughter because she will be able to continue supporting herself with the profits she earns.  She dreams about having her own store.  This is her first loan from FAMA and she hopes to comply with the commitment of making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Daniela Del Socorro

texts.es: Daniela del Socorro es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio con muchos esfuerzos y que ha tenido mucho éxito. La actividad a  económica es un taller textil donde le realiza trabajo a muchas de la empresas que la visitan por la calidad que les ofrece. Daniela aprendió desde muy joven este negocio y le gusto mucho, ya que  les enseño a sus  hijos  también este negocio que trabajan junto con ella en el taller para sacar los encargos que las empresas le solicitan como la elaboración de pantalones, gorras, mochilas, bolsos entre otros encargos. Daniela del Socorro está solicitando financiamiento a Fundación León 2000, para poder comprar materia prima como telas para la elaboración de los diferentes pendidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniela del Socorro is an entrepreneur who, with lots of hard work, started her own business and has had a lot of success.  She has a textile shop where she does her work and there are many businesses that visit for the quality she offers. 
 
Daniela learned this business at a young age and she really likes it.  She also taught her children this business and they work with her in the shop to fill the orders that businesses place.  They make pants, hats, backpacks, bags, and other orders.  

Daniela del Socorro is requesting a loan through Fundación León 2000 to buy raw materials such as fabric so she can fill her customer's different orders.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as fabric to fill her orders.

loans.name: Maria Eyised

texts.es: La señora Maria Eyised se dedica a la elaboración de todo tipo de artesanías con madera, telas, joyas, hilos y bisutería gracias a los conocimientos adquiridos en una institución de Puerto Triunfo (municipio ubicado al oriente de Antioquia). Como la señora Maria Eyised es madre soltera requiere de la compra de materia prima con la cual pueda hacer sus productos, venderlos y obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hija de 5 años. El sueño de la señora Maria Eyised es tener su propio almacén y brindarles buena educación y vivienda a su hija y padres.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Eyised makes all kinds of crafts out of wood, fabric, jewelry, yarn and imitation jewelry thanks to what she learned at an institution in Puerto Triunfo (a town located east of Antioquia).  Since Señora Maria Eyised is a single mother, she needs to buy raw materials with which to make her products, sell them and bring in the necessary income to support her 5 year old daughter.  

Señora Maria Eyised's dream is to have her own store, give her daughter a good education, and provide her daughter and parents with a nice house.

loans.use: purchase raw materials such as wood, yarn, fabric and imitation jewelry.

loans.name: Trigal Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Trigal” está conformado por 21 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran repostería, chocolatería, joyería, venta de ropa y juguetes, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Irma integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es corto color castaño oscuro, usa un sweater color negro, jeans color celeste y zapatos negros. Para una mayor referencia se encuentra detrás de una señora de cabello cano y una señora quien viste una chaqueta bordo metálico o brillante.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para varón, dama y niños. Específicamente lencería y ropa interior, también vende ropa para la casa. Trabaja en éste negocio desde hace 2 años. Ofrece su mercadería puerta a puerta y también desde su casa, por lo que su horario es relativo y los fines de semana los destina para su familia y su hogar.
Próximamente arrendará un local establecido, lo que le permitirá abastecer su negocio con una mayor cantidad de mercadería.
Su mercadería la compra en dos grandes distribuidoras y las realiza por encomienda.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de casa.
Sus metas en su negocio son independizarse y que éste le brinde la posibilidad de obtener mayores utilidades.
Irma vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 18 y 2 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia la carrera de Administración de empresas. Uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es viajar con su familia y disfrutar de unas buenas vacaciones.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Comenta que ha sido una ayuda inmensa.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, éstas le han permitido conocer nuevas estrategias de inversión y contabilidad. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que han compartido experiencias similares. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
The community bank, called "Trigal", is comprised of 21 entrepreneurs who run different businesses including a confectioners, a chocolate store, a jewelry store, clothes and toy sales, and others. They are all from the city of Puerto Montt. 
Irma, a member of the community bank, is in the second row of the photo in the fourth place from left to right. She has short, chestnut-colored hair and is wearing a black sweater and light blue jeans and black shoes. For further reference, she is between a woman with gray hair and a woman who is wearing a shiny metallic jacket.
She works selling new clothes for men, women, and children. She specializes in lingerie and underwear and also sells household linens. She has been doing this work for 2 years. She sells her goods door to door and also from her home, and so her timetable is flexible and she can keep the weekends for her family and home.
She will soon lease a store and this will enable her to stock her business with a greater quantity of merchandise. 
She buys her goods by the parcel from 2 large distributors. 
She will use the loan to buy household linens. 
Her goals for her business are to become independent which will give her the opportunity for higher profits.
Irma lives with her husband and 2 children who are 18 and 2 years old. Her oldest son is studying business. One of her personal goals is to travel with her family and enjoy some good vacations. 
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business. She says that it has been a huge help. 
The trainings have taught her new strategies for investment and accounting. What's more, she feels very comfortable with the community bank that she is a part of as they have shared similar experiences. 
Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the region of Los Lagos. Puerto Montt's attractions include beautiful green countryside, quiet beaches, great food (particularly the fish and seafood), and its crafts. It is also the port of entrance for Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in traditional and legends.

loans.use: to buy household linens.

loans.name: Diana Yadira

texts.es: La  señora   Diana  es  una  persona  muy  emprendedora,  actualmente  ella  tiene  un   negocio de  venta  de  ropa  usada   el  cual  le permite  salir  adelante   día   con  día además  de desempeñar  el trabajo  que  mas le  gusta  el  cual  son las  ventas  ya  que a  sentido  cierta  atracción  al respecto, en esta  ocasión se  acerco  con  nosotros  ya  que   desea  realizar  la compra  de ropa  usada  para  su  negocio,  ve  en el crédito  la  posibilidad  de  hacer   crecer   su  negocio lo  cual  le  permitirá   generar  mayores  ingresos  además  de  continuar   brindándole  a sus clientes  el  excelente servicio que  la a caracterizado.
texts.en: Diana is a very hardworking person and she currently has a business selling used clothes which enables her to move ahead day by day as well as letting her do the work she likes best, which is selling things, as she feels a certain attraction to this work. At this time, she has come to us as she wants to buy clothes for her business and she sees the loan as offering her the possibility to grow her business and generate better income while continuing to offer her customers the excellent service that is characteristic of her.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: El señor Álvaro a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a prestar el servicio de reparación de automóviles desde su propio taller de mecánica a domicilio acondicionado en la parte trasera de su vehículo. El señor Álvaro es reconocido por su excelente servicio y cómodos precios. Con el fin de mejorar el servicio que presta y poder realizar trabajos completos, el señor Álvaro necesita de la compra de herramienta de trabajo que le facilite su labor y pueda prestar un mejor servicio puesto que el invierno afecta su trabajo y actualmente no cuenta con recursos económicos para hacer esta adquisición que necesita con urgencia. El sueño del señor Álvaro es tener su propio taller de mecánica en un local fijo.
texts.en: Álvaro is 47 years old and works repairing cars from his own mechanic's workshop which he has set-up in the back of his car. Álvaro is known for his excellent service and affordable prices. With the goal of improving the service that he offers, Álvaro needs to buy work tools that will help in his work and enable him to offer a better service because the winter affects his work and he currently doesn't have the economic resources to make these purchases that he urgently needs. Álvaro's dream is to have his own mechanic's workshop in a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, zinc, stone, iron, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: Paula Argentina es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ella explica que gracias a la oportunidad que le han brindaron con el financiamiento ha cambiado su vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne lo cual ya tiene definido a sus clientes fijos y eventuales a los que les ofrece sus producto. Paula Argentina está nuevamente solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio y comprar carne de res, cerdo, pollo, pelibuey entre otras que le demanda.
texts.en: Paula Argentina is an entrepreneur who has worked before with Fundación León 2000. She explains that the opportunity they offered her with the loan changed her life. She sells meat and has regular  and new customers to whom she offers her product. Paula Argentina is asking for a loan again to invest in her business by buying beef, pork, chicken and mutton, among other meats her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, chicken, mutton and other meats that people have asked her for.

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es: Personas empeñosas por salir a delante, de esta manera se denominan los integrantes del grupo “Siempre unidos”, grupo conformado por 9 socias que entre el hogar y sus familias ven la forma de llevar ingresos económicos a sus hogares por medio de sus negocios. Tal así es el caso de la señora Esperanza de 59 años de edad conviviente y con 5 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, que está en el grupo 7 años y hace más de 25 años la señora Esperanza se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos en un mercado grande. Gracias a este negocio  a podido darles educación a todos sus hijos y construir su casa esto lo hace con el mejor de los esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante cada día por el bien de ella y su familia y en el futuro le gustaría dedicarse a la exportación de artesanía peruana. Con el reciente préstamo ella invertirá en la compra de insumos para su negocio.
texts.en: These people are dedicated to getting ahead. They are the members of the group called “Siempre Unidos” [Always United]. It is made up of 9 people who, with their families, find the way to bring income home from their businesses. That is the case of Esperanza, who is 59 and in a common law marriage with 5 children who are all grown. She has been on the group for 7 years and for 25 years Esperanza has sold fish and seafood in a large market. Thanks to this business, she has been able to give an education to all of her children and build a house. She has done this with her best efforts to get ahead day to day for her and her family. In the future, she would like to export Peruvian artisanal crafts. With the recent loan she will invest in buying materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar vive la señora  Julia, ella tiene 43 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene dos hijos de  19 y 18 años de edad,  los mismos  aun viven con ella y estudian en la universidad. Está desde hace 7 ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le agrada por la forma como trabaja la institución, ya con los créditos se ha ayudado a muchas personas como a su esposo y a su familia.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se  dedica al comercio, tiene una carnicería en el centro de la ciudad  en el cual vende carne , más que todo carne de chancho, su esposo trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, en las mañanas vende en su local y luego en las tardes el se deslaza al campo a compra los chanchos para luego llevarlos a los centros de faenamiento y así tiene carne para la venta del próximo dia.  El lleva más de 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos para la venta de la semana que va a ser muy buena.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro ya que para comprar los chanchos fletan transporte.
texts.en:
In the fortress El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí known for many years ago as the city of the real tamarinds, the associates of the "Reborn" communal bank gather every fifteen days.  

In this place lives señora Julia.  She is 43 years old and she has two children ages 19 and 18 who live with her and study in the university.  She has had 7 loan cycles with the Communal Bank and she tells us that she is pleased with the way that the institution works.  The loans have helped many people like her husband and family.

She is a great housewife who requests the loan for her husband who is in commerce.  He has a meat market in the center of the city in which he sells meat, especially pork.  Her husband works every day from 5AM to 3PM.  In the mornings he sells in his market and in the afternoon he goes to the field to buy pigs in order to take them to the slaughter house and thus have meat for sale the next day.  He has carried out this business for more than 8 years and it goes very well.  This loan will be used to buy pigs to sell in the week when sales are very good. It is his dream to buy a car so that he does not have to pay for transporting the pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, ella tiene  76 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos todos ellos  mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja en carpintería.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña sus clientes consiguen de todo,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, en su negocio se entretiene con sus amistades y conocidos que llegan todos los días  hasta su local, lleva más de 15 años con su tienda y le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva más de 12 años en el  Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the fortress El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the associates of the “Reborn” Communal Bank gather every fifteen days.  

In this place we find señora Vicenta.  She is 76 years of age.  She is married and has seven children all of legal age and independent.  Her husband works in carpentry.  

She has a grocery store in her house, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent, among other things.  In spite of the fact that her store is small, her clients obtain all they need.  She works every day from 6AM to 8PM and at times until later.  In her business she is entertained by her friends and acquaintances that arrive every day to her location.  She has run the store for more than 15 years and it has gone well.  

This loan is going to be used to supply her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and detergent, among other grocery products.  She has been with the Communal Bank for more than 12 years and she likes it because she has made more friends in the group.  Her goals are to continue ahead with her business and to grow her store more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other grocery products.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 59 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, así como amable y cordial, esta casado con Auria quien es ama  de casa. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos de 19, 18 y 15 años a quienes quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Jorge es la agricultura, tiene un terreno de 27 hectáreas, donde 15 hectáreas están sembradas con diferentes plantaciones como naranjas, piñas, y yuca, siendo su principal producto, el cual viene cultivando desde hace 18 años. Ahora por el volumen de su cosecha necesita el apoyo de al menos 5 peones a los que paga por día trabajado un jornal de 20 nuevos soles. Asimismo comenta que le gusta la vida de campo, conoce el trabajo, pues desde joven sus padres le enseñaron esta labor. Sin embargo el cansancio físico no le ayuda en el trabajo, pero le llena de satisfacción los ingresos económicos, ya que con ello puede darle una mejor educación a sus hijos. Tienes planes de ampliar e incursionar en la siembra de palma aceitera. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo para crecer  en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la siembra de yuca, tiene planeado sembrar al menos 2 hectáreas de yuca.
texts.en: Jorge, a 59-year-old, is an industrious and diligent, as well as kind and cordial man.  He is married to Auria, who is a housewife.  Together they inhabit their own house in company with their three children ages 19, 18 and 15, whom they love very much.  The activity that Jorge carries out is agriculture.  He has 27 hectares of land, where 15 hectares are sown with different plantations such as oranges, pineapples, and yucca, the latter being his main product, which he has cultivated for 18 years.  Now the volume of his crop requires the support of at least 5 laborers, who he pays a daily wage of 20 new soles for a days work.  He says that he likes life in the field.  He knows the work, since his parents taught him this work as a child.  Nevertheless the physical exhaustion does not help in the work, but he is full of satisfaction with the economic income, since with it he can give a better education to his children.  He has plans to expand and to begin sowing oil producing palms.  This it will be his 8th loan with the institution MFP.  He is thankful for the support that he receives to grow his business.  With the requested total of 2000 new soles, he will invest in sowing yucca.  He plans to sow at least 2 hectares of yucca.

loans.use: to hire laborers and to buy yucca seeds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is the owner of Millennium Plus Property Management, LLC, which has operated a self-service laundromat business in the Greater New Orleans area for the past nine years. 

Gloria was perfectly content working her nine-to-five accounting job, but when her husband Ronald was laid off from his job, things changed drastically. Ronald decided that he wanted to open his own business. Although slightly nervous about her husband's newly found business venture, Gloria was confident that if they provided excellent customer service and a great product they would be successful. 

And indeed The Laundry Center was a success; with two locations, one in Jefferson parish and the other in Orleans parish, 10 employees and a thriving individual and corporate clientele … then, Hurricane Katrina came and devastated the city. The New Orleans location flooded, resulting in a total loss. 

Gloria says that Hurricane Katrina was a two-fold experience. "Yes, it was very stressful and emotional, but after the storm, we were able to build an industry name for ourselves, " explains Gloria. Recovery was slow after the storm and not many businesses were open, but The Laundry Center's Jefferson location was open. The customer loyalty that they had gained over the years allowed the store to prosper and continue providing services to original customers, as well as new customers. 

Gloria is confident that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to expand the services provided to include pickup and delivery service for large corporations such as hotels and airports. 

Gloria is extremely grateful for the Kiva program, as she would not have been able to get financing through any other source because of the losses her business experienced due to the storm. 

Gloria will use the Kiva loan to perform maintenance to the washers and dryers, complete minor repairs to the building and cover a few months of operating expenses.

loans.use: to purchase laundry equipment

loans.name: Paola Alaxandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paola, ella tiene  33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 3 años, la mayor estudian en colegio, ella en la actualidad vive en casa de sus padres.

Ella es una muy buena madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lo que más vende son los perfumes y la bisutería ya que son muy buenos.  Lleva más de 1  año con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y sobretodo los productos que están de oferta y aprovechar las ventas para la temporada que se avecina. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios que le da el banco.
 
Su sueño es que a sus pequeños hijos no les falte nada ya que por eso lucha todos los días.
texts.en:
In the fortress El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the associates of the “Reborn” Communal Bank gather every fifteen days.  

In this place we find señora Paola.  She is 33 years of age.  She is separated and has two children ages 11 and 3 years.  The oldest child attends school.  She currently lives in her parents’ home.  

She is a very good mother who is dedicated to commerce so that her children lack nothing.  She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies).  She works three days of the week.  She sells her products on credit and collects every eight days.  The perfumes and costume jewelry are her best sellers, since they are very good.  She has carried out this business for more than 1 year and it goes very well.  

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and above all the products that are being offered to take advantage of the sales for the season that approaches.  She has had four loans with the Communal Bank and she likes the benefits that the bank gives her.  Her dream is that her small children lack nothing and for this she strives every day.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: José Wilfredo

texts.es:
José Wilfredo tiene 23 años de edad, y reside junto a su esposa y a su pequeño hijo en el caserío Lloque Yupanqui del Distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente mango y limón, la zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

José Wilfredo trabaja en ganadería, él cuenta actualmente con ovejas y pavos los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola. Con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades el sustenta la economía de su familia.
 
El desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales, así como también desea realizar mejoras en su corral para poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

José es una persona conocida y respetada en la comunidad donde reside, este es su primer crédito con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
José Wilfredo is 23 years old and lives with his wife and their young son in the hamlet of Lloque Yupanqui, in Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural area that primarily produces mangoes and limes. It is located in the Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, capital city of the Lambayeque region.

José Wilfredo's business is cattle. He also has sheep and turkeys that he raises and fattens to sell at the local market. In addition, he works as a farm laborer. He supports his family economically with the income from these activities.

He hopes to acquire a balanced diet in order to fatten his animals. He would also like to make improvements to his corral so that he can continue growing his business and improve his family's quality of life.

José is a person who is well-known and respected in the community where he lives. This is his first loan through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy a balanced diet for his animals and to improve his corrals

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es: Maria Delia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pasteles, ademas tiene otro negocio que es la de costura que tambien se ayuda con este negocio generando mas ingreso para la familia. Desde hace mas de 16 años que tiene este medio de vida. Fue por iniciativa propia que decide comenzar con esta actividad ya que necesitaba ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos que son 2 y sacarlos adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de huevos, harina, piña, harina, pollo, queso, leche, entre otros productos necesarios para su elaboración. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda y poder proporcionarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Delia makes and sells pastries. She also has a second business which is sewing, enabling her to generate additional income for her family.

She has had this livelihood for more than 16 years. It was through her own initiative that she decided to start this activity, as she needed income for supporting her two children, and for helping them get ahead in life.

The purpose of the loan is to buy eggs, flour, pineapple, chicken, cheese, milk, and other ingredients needed for her baking.

She dreams about improving her house, and providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy eggs, flour, pineapple, chicken, cheese, milk, and other necessary products.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 57 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de ser amable y cordial, esta casado con Alicia quien es ama de casa. Vive en compañía de su esposa y de uno de sus hijos de 22 años ya que los otros dos son independientes. La actividad que realiza Víctor es la agricultura contando con un terreno de 6 hectáreas y del cual utiliza 3 hectáreas cultivando yuca. Producto que una vez cosechado es comercializado en el mercados de Lima y así como a otros mercados de su localidad. Tiene a su cargo 4 peones, a quienes paga por día trabajado un monto de 20 nuevos soles. Le gusta su actividad porque le gusta trabajar en el campo, comenta que se inició en ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio y como ya tenía conocimientos básicos lo puso en práctica. Asimismo en su casa de campo cuenta con luz eléctrica por lo que se sienten más cómodo. Su plan es ampliar sus ingresos económicos poniendo una bodega en su casa, para que su esposa pueda atenderlo. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero para lograr alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general para implementar su nueva bodega donde atenderá su esposa.
texts.en:
Víctor is 57, and a hard-working, enterprising man, besides being warm and friendly. He is married to Alicia, who is a housewife. He lives with his wife and one of his children, who is 22, as the other two are on their own. 

Victor is a farmer, and has a six-hectare piece of land, of which he uses three hectares for growing yuca. Once the product is harvested, he sells it in the Lima markets, as well as in other markets in his area. He has hired four workers, whom he pays the amount of 20 nuevos soles for each day of work. 

He likes what he does, because he likes to work in the countryside. He says that he got started in this business because he needed a trade, and as he already had the basic knowledge, he put it into practice. As well, he has electricity in his rural home, so they feel more comfortable. 

His plan is to increase his income by setting up a store in his house, so that his wife can look after it. This will be his fifth loan with MFP. He feels thankful to receive the financial support for reaching his objectives. 

He also says that he is comfortable with the work of his communal bank, as he considers its members to be responsible people. 

With the amount of 3,000 nuevos soles that he has applied for, he will buy assorted groceries for launching his new store that his wife will run.

loans.use: To buy basic household products to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Cecilia Matilde

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y aun viven en su casa, dos de ellas estudian en universidad. Su marido es chofer.
 
Ella hace muchos años aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia de la localidad y hoy tiene un salón de belleza en su casa en el cual  realiza diversidad de trabajos, como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas, entre otros trabajos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios, ella también realiza trabajos a domicilio cuando sus clientes lo requieren. Además también en su local ella vende productos de belleza. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes, esmaltes de uñas, entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en todo este tiempo, ella es la secretaria del grupo.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the fortress El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the associates of the “Reborn” Communal Bank gather every fifteen days.  

In this place lives señora Cecilia.  She is 41 years of age and has three children, all of legal age and, although they live in her house,  two of them study at the university.  Her husband is a chauffeur.  She learned to be a beautician many years ago in a local academy and today she has a beauty parlor in her house in which she carries out a diversity of works, such as dying and styling hair and painting nails, among other things.  She works every day from 8AM to 8PM and at times until later if her clients require her services.  She also works in the home of her clients when they require it.  Besides this she also sells beauty products in her home.   She has been dedicated to this activity for more than 10 years and it goes very well.  

This loan will be used to buy hair colors, permanent solution, and nail enamels, among other things.  She has been with the Communal Bank from the start and she appreciates the aid that it has given her in all this time.  She is the secretary of the group.  

Her dream is to continue ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy permanent solution, hair coloring and nail enamels.

loans.name: Terrizene

texts.en:
The tagline for Terrizene's accounting service is, "It's in the relationship." Terrizene has a degree in accounting from Dillard University and has been doing accounting work for over 30 years. The relationship she establishes with her clients is very important to her because Terrizene is passionate about helping New Orleans' small businesses and non-profits succeed. 

Terrizene is now in the process of transitioning her home-based accounting practice to a commercial space. She plans to use her Kiva loan to lease office space and to buy furniture, fixtures, and equipment. Between January and May, Terrizene is busy with tax season, and from May to December she assists non-profits with audit preparation, accounting systems set-up, policies and procedures, and prepares budgets for grant applications. Her clients have included: museums, public advocacy groups, outdoor education providers, and charter schools. 

Terrizene has lived in New Orleans her entire life except for a short period of time immediately after Hurricane Katrina, when she lived in Baton Rouge. Even in Baton Rouge, under very difficult circumstances, Terri continued to provide her accounting expertise to New Orleans' charter schools. She and the founder and principal of one of those schools did all of the school administration, continuing payroll and helping to create a makeshift school for displaced New Orleans school children. As life returns to normal in New Orleans, Terrizene grows more passionate about helping non-profits and small businesses by providing them with her expert accounting services. 

Terrizene is excited about spending the holiday season with her son and daughter, and her two young grandsons.

loans.use: to lease office space and purchase furniture, fixtures and equipment

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Carlos, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, le agrada la sinceridad y el trato amable, es conviviente con Dalila, quien es ama de casa, y además tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad, y 4 primos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Carlos es la siembra de yuca para esto cuenta con un terreno de 25 hectáreas que compró hace 10 años, tiempo que viene realizando ésta actividad. Ahí tiene 02 hectáreas en producción de yuca más 03 hectáreas que están en proceso de sembrar. Adicionalmente a esto siembra arroz por temporada e incluso alquila el terreno a 200 nuevos soles por 01 hectárea producida. Pero para su propia actividad contrata el apoyo de hasta 05 peones para que lo ayuden en la siembra y cosecha de su producto acordando un pago diario de 20 nuevos soles a cada uno. Le gusta su vida de campo pues está acostumbrado vivir de esa manera  y además le genera ganancias para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Al contrario comenta que no le agrada cuando se malogra su cosecha por alguna plaga, pero no se desanima y continúa trabajando. Tiene planes de seguir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer aumentando la producción de yuca. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles tiene planes de invertir en la siembra de  01 hectárea más de yuca para así ampliar su producción y poder atender la demanda de su producto.
texts.en: Carlos, a 33-year-old, is a diligent and industrious man.  He enjoys sincerity and fair dealing.  He lives with Delilah, who is a housewife, their 3-year-old son and 4 cousins.  Together they inhabit their own house.  The activity that Carlos carries out is the sowing of yucca.  For this he relies on 25 hectares of land that he bought 10 years ago.  He has carried out this activity since that time.  There are 2 hectares already in production of yucca and 3 more hectares that are in the process of being sown.  In addition to this he sows rice in season and even rents the land for 200 new soles per hectare.  But for his own activity he contracts the support of up to 5 laborers so that they can help with the sowing and harvesting of his crop, earning a daily payment of 20 new soles each.  He likes life in the field and is accustomed to living in this manner, besides which it generates him profits to be able to settle the household expenses and to offer his family a better quality of life.  On the contrary he says that it does not please him when he loses a crop to some plague, but he is not discouraged and continues working.  He has plans to continue in his business and to expand his production of yucca.  This will be his second  loan with the institution MFP.  He waits for the loans contribution so that he can finalize his plans.  On the other hand, he promises to comply with the payment schedule as he did on his previous loan.  With the requested total of 1000 new soles he has plans to invest in the sowing of 1 hectare more of yucca to  expand his production and to be able to attend to the demand for his product.

loans.use: to buy yucca seeds and contract laborers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú. María tiene 56 años edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos, ella tiene tres actividades principales que son: ella vende verduras los días domingos en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella vende chicha de jora los días lunes, miércoles y sábados en su propio domicilio y también ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y pertenece a la asociación de criadores de cuyes de la ciudad de Yucay. En esta oportunidad Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes.  

Maria es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en el ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en el ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and she lives in the same city where she was born.  The Peruvian district of Huayallabamba is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba province in the Cusco department, Cusco Región, Perú.

Maria, age 56, is married and has six children.  Maria has three main business activities.  On Sundays she sells vegetables at one of the most popular markets in the city of Urubamba.  She sells “chicha” (a corn based drink) from her house on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays.  She also raises guinea pigs from the city of Yucay.

At this time Maria needs the loan to buy more guinea pigs.  Maria is a member of the Virgen Natividad communal bank.  The bank is comprised of 15 members.  Some of them live in the city of Huayllabamba, and others live in the city of Yucay.  The Peruvian district of Yucay is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba province.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de los padres.

Ella estudia cosmetología en una Universidad de Portoviejo, además de ser una muy buena estudiante para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarse con los gastos de sus estudios, realiza trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal y así saca provecho de lo que está estudiando, realiza diversidad de trabajos, como tinturados, maquillajes, pintado de uñas,  etc. Trabaja todos los días cuando  sus clientes requieren de sus servicios, ella también realiza trabajos en su casa y a domicilio. Lleva más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien a pesar de que aun no cuenta con un local establecido las herramientas necesarias.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, maquillajes, tijeras, cepillos, cremas, etc. útiles para su trabajo. Este es su tercer ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son algún dia tener un SPA y por lo pronto terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” (Reborn) communal bank meets every two weeks in the residential community of El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  It has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

This is where 19 year old María lives.  She is single and lives in her parents’ house.  She is studying cosmetology in a university in Portoviejo.  In addition to being a very good student in order to obtain her own resources and help with her educational expenses, she does beauty and personal grooming jobs to take advantage of what she is studying.  She does a diversity of jobs like hair coloring, make-up, and manicures, etc.

She works every day when her customers require her services.  She also does jobs in her house and at the customer’s house.  She has been doing this business activity for four years.  It is going very well for her even though she does not have an established place and the equipment that she needs.

She will use this loan to buy hair coloring, make-up, scissors, brushes, and creams, etc.  These items are useful in her work.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it for the ease of getting the loans.

Her dreams are to one day have a Spa and to finish her studies soon.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring, make-up, scissors, brushes, and creams, etc

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú. 

Rayda tiene 26 años edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella tiene dos actividades economicas principales que son: ella vende verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, tomates, ajo y otras más en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Urubamba y ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad Rayda requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras como tomates y cebollas. Su sueño de Rayda es abrir uina tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad donde nació.   

Rayda es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en el ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en el ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Rayda was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and she lives in the same city where she was born.  The Peruvian district of Huayallabamba is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba province in the Cusco department, Cusco Región, Perú.

Rayda, age 26, is married and has two children.  She has two main business activities.  She sells vegetables like onions, tomatoes, garlic, and others in one of the most popular markets in the city of Urubamba.  She also raises young animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

At this time Rayda needs the loan to buy more vegetables like tomatoes and onions.  Rayda’s dream is to open a grocery store in the city where she was born.

Rayda is a member of the Virgen Natividad communal bank.  The bank is comprised of 15 members.  Some of them live in the city of Huayllabamba, and others live in the city of Yucay.  The Peruvian district of Yucay is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba province.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida así como amable y alegre, es conviviente con Félix quien también es agricultor, vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. Comenta que por el momento están habitando una casa alquilada.
