Rosalia has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. She sells items like detergent and bath soap, purified water and canned goods. Rosalia earns 4,000 PHP per month from her store. Rosalia also cooks food items such as rice cakes to sell in her community.

Rosalia has requested this loan to buy ingredients and more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks. Rosalia hopes to continue earning and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 39-year-old businessman who is married to Susan. They are blessed with eight children. 

He has been a tailor for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Paul will use the loan to buy clothing materials for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop that will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her animal selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy sheep and goats in larger numbers. She will raise them up and eventually sell them to butchers for profit.
She is confident that her business will get more successful as a result of a loan investment. She is very experienced in her business and has good business contacts.
Her husband is a property dealer and deals in property.
She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a driver while the younger one is a laborer. Her daughter stays at home and helps Safia in her routine tasks.
In the picture, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.”

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for the animal selling business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey and her husband, Sos, are rice farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition, Srey also sells grocery items at home. She is asking for another loan again to assist in her rice farm by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. 

The couple has been married since 1991 and has five children-three sons and two daughters. Four are in school and one is still too young for school. They live in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Photo: Srey is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle and buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Emmanuela

texts.en:
Emmanuela is a 28 year old married woman with two children, one of them is in school. She has had a business selling sugar in kator south Sudan for three years.
Emmanuela is requesting a loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married to a driver and has eight dependents. They live at Akotokyire. 

Vivian sells charcoal. She has been selling charcoal for four years. Vivian uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family.  

She needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ameeran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran bibi is 44 years old, a widow and operates a grocery store in her community. She has been operating it for over five years.  

She as the head of her household works to achieve a better future for her family.  She is the mother of six children who are 17, 12, 10, 7, 5 and 4 years old. Her eldest daughter knows the responsibilities of her mother and also understands her position. That is why Ameeran's daughter tries to provide comfort to her mother by supplementing Ameeran's income through her sewing works.

Ameeran dreams of continuing to grow so she can go on helping her family in that way.

Ameeran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy groceries, beverages and bakery products for her store to increase her sales.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran bibi”.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and bakery products for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy (in the photo), age 47, is a widower with three sons and two daughters. One of the children has full-time employment, three of the others attend school. Another one raises ducks for a living. He is hired and gets paid with fees. The family lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vuthy is a soldier. He is applying for a loan of $800 to purchase new motorcycles for commuting because the old one breaks and uses more gasoline than the new ones.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 51 years old and married to Mukui. They have seven children.

He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is applying for his third loan of KES 50,000. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy farm inputs. He plans to expand his farming to include a beekeeping project and buy a dairy cow in future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 49 years old and a businessman. He is married to Beth. They are blessed with three children, age 21, 19 and 17 years. 

He has been running a green grocer store for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio (pictured here) sells fruit. She buys fruits from Phnom Penh market and carries them by bicycle to resell in her village. Her husband, Both is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Tuk Tuk is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back. His trailer is old and breaks and he wants to repair it. He does not have money. 
In 2009, Rio asked for a loan to replace a Tuk Tuk because his Tuk Tuk taxi broke in some parts, and he used the loan to replace Tuk Tuk as planned. He now wants to ask for another loan to buy a new trailer because it broke again.  
Hence Rio is applying for a loan of $300 to purchase a new trailer for her husband.
 
The couple lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have one daughter who is in school.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer for her husband.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 36 years old and married. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. 

Rosalinda has been growing and selling rice for two years. She earns 3,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Rosalinda has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Rosalinda hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest. Rosalinda also hopes to have enough money to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Azel

texts.ru: Азел- 38 лет, замужем и воспитывает четырех детей, младшей из которых семь месяцев. В поисках источника финансирования, Азел начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, использовав для этой цели сумму в 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Азел, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется две  дойные коровы, один теленок,  одна лошадь, что позволяет получать в месяц около 3,000 сом от продажи молока.  Также , Азел занимается пошивом национальных изделий, пользующихся спросом среди местного населения, что позволяет иметь небольшой доход в бюджет семьи.   Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азел обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Часть доходов от кредита Азел планирует вложить в посев фасоли и картофеля, а в будущем – накопить денег на оплату обучения сына.
texts.en:
Azel is 38 years old, married and raising four children, of which the youngest one is five months. In the search of a source of funding, Azel started her business in animal husbandry, using an amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for this purpose. 

Thanks to Azel's hard work, the farm currently has two dairy cows, one calf and one horse, which earns her 3,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk. Azel also sews national products, in demand among the local population, which allows for a small income for the family budget. 

For the further development of her business, Azel turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows. Azel plans to invest part of the income from the loan in sowing beans and potatoes, and in the future save money to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Thay

texts.en:
Thay (in the photo) and his wife, Sokhon, are rice, hemp and lotuses farmers. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple requested Kiva loans a few times already. They hope to continue their farming business because it is a business they have been in for almost thirty years. 

Hence Thay is applying for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

Thay and his wife have been married since 1970 and have nine children-six sons and three daughters. Four are married and live in a separate home, two work in a garment factory, two have full-time employment and another one is in school.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 37-year-old business lady who is married to John. They are blessed with three children. 

She has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Monicah will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and open a wholesale shop that will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Ra, age 30, is a garment worker. Her husband, Hoeun Nou, age 30 is a construction worker. They have been married since 2008 and have one son who is in school. They are living in a village about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ra does not have her own motorbike; she borrows the motorbike from her relative to get work every day. That is why she decided to request the loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle. Ra will not ask to borrow her relative's motorbike any more. 

Photo: Ra and her husband are not pictured at home, but at a pagoda.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to get work.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is 28 years old and single, supporting two children.

He has been a shopkeeper for the last one year from which he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 15,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more goods for sale to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for his shop.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly (in the photo) is 44 years old and her husband Chuon is 54 years old. The live in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four sons and three daughters; three children are married and live outside the family home, three are construction workers and another one attends school.   

Sokly sells grocery items, while her husband is a construction worker. Sokly is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her son, who is in construction, to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 26-year-old boutique owner in Shanzu, Mombasa. 

She is married, and has been running clothes retail boutique business for the last four years, and is doing great. Since she was introduced to KADET, this marks her fourth loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase more skirts, trousers, blouses, handbags, and shoes to add to her stock. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her boutique further and hopes to have a bigger boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more skirts, trousers, blouses, handbags, and shoes.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey (in the photo), age 38, is a vegetable seller. Her husband, Sambo, age 39, is a security guard. They have been married since 1993 and have four children-three sons and one daughter. One child has full-time employment and other three attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Srey is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the walls of her house because they are old and break.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 24 years old. She was married at an early age and has a son and a daughter. Both of them are young and haven’t started their education yet.
Her husband is a laborer and earns a low income.
In order to financially support her husband, Bushra sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.
She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and increase her profits.

She has good experience and all the required skills in her business and is confident that by purchasing a new sewing machine, she will be able to attract more clients and be able to produce quality work.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is 48 years old and married. She and her husband have four children.

She has been in the business of cooking and selling foodstuffs for the last two years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 19,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000.She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy foodstuffs (wheat and rice) for cooking. Her dream is to open up a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs (wheat and rice) for cooking.

loans.name: Amude

texts.en: Amude is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Amude is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old and married to Joshua. They have three children.

She has been in the business of sewing clothes for the last fourteen years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan to buy a sewing machine and also plans to open up another branch in the future.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 53 года, замужем. В поисках источника финансирования, в 2000 году Бурул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки 4 голов овец.  Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, на сегодня в ее хозяйстве имеется 20 голов овец, что позволяет получать прибыль около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Burul is 53 years old and married. In search of a source of funding, Burul in 2000 began her own business in animal husbandry, having started with the purchase of four heads of sheep. Thanks to the persistent hard work of Burul, her household today has 20 sheep which allows her to receive a profit of about 5,000 Som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Burul applied to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. Burul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of her domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kion

texts.en: Mrs. Kion has worked growing rice since she was a teenager. She is now 60 years old and blessed with six children. Two of them are living together with her in her own home in the Baray district and help support the family by selling fresh fish in a local market in the province. Kion finds that her two daughters have difficulties transporting fish to sell at the market without a motorcycle, and she really wishes to help them. So she decided to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy a used motorcycle to support her daughters’ business. She is very grateful and hopes that the loan will change her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Siama

texts.en: Siama is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for seven years. Siama is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 32 years old and single.

He has been in the business of servicing motor vehicles and selling spare parts for the last five years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 70,000. He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy a wheel alignment machine and a crank shaft machine. He plans to to open another branch for selling motor vehicle spares in the future.

loans.use: To buy a wheel alignment machine and a crank shaft machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 52-year-old second-hand clothes dealer in Tudor, Mombasa.
 
She is single and has been doing this business for the last 15 years and she is doing great. 

She was recently introduced to KADET  and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more second-hand blouses, trousers, skirts and shirts to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further. 

Her dream is to have several wholesale outlets of clothes shops.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand blouses, trousers, skirts and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 53-year-old businessman. He is a widower with three children.  

He has been selling firewood for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy more firewood for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop for his son. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is  a 21-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has run a food stall in Kator, South Sudan, for three years. Jane is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Kiden is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 29 years old, married, and lives with her family; a husband and three children who are 8, 6 and 4 years old. Her first two children are studying, while her youngest one doesn’t go to school. 

Nusrat's husband has a business of selling rice. He sells rice to different retailers and earns on profits. He is famous among his clients due to the quality and good in dealing. He has been operating his business for over 10 years.  

Nusrat herself is also a very talented lady. She operates a carpet weaving business. She weaves good quality carpets and sells on profits. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy rice of good quality, in bulk quantity, for resale. She is hopeful that her husband will be grown up with his business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 46 years old and married to Mohamed. They have four children.

She has been in the business of cooking and selling food for the last five years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She plans to use the funds to buy foodstuffs (wheat and rice) for cooking and selling, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (wheat and rice).

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 34-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had her business selling tea in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Hawa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old widow with four children.

She has been in the business of selling cabbages, onions, and tomatoes for the last eight years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more grocery stock for resale (cabbages, onions, and tomatoes) and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a businesswoman who sells bags.  She has operated the business for seventeen years.  Previously, she used to sell cereals.
  
She started her business after relocating to a new town.  She received capital of 20,000 Kenya shillings from Faulu Kenya. Since then, she has grown her business.

Eunice hopes to expand her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy bags.

loans.use: to buy bags.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for one year. Anita is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ngabori

texts.en:
Ngabori is 34 years old and married to Nkatile. They have seven children.

He has been in the business of buying and selling cows and goats for the last sixteen years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 59,000. He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 100,000. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more cows and goats for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
33-year-old Rosie is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 11.

Rosie has been growing and selling rice for three years. Rosie is able to support her family through her business. She hopes to have a better income so she can sustain her children's education.

Rosie has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and pay for labor. Rosie hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Vikindu Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who go to school.  She has been running a retail business since 2002.  She works from 6.00 am to 10.00 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her shop and to pay school fees and household expenses. She has paid back her first loan successfully. She wants a loan to re-stock missing items in the shop.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will hold this loan with her loan group "Vikindu," which has a total of 22 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.  (The person writing in the background of the photo is not part of the group.)

loans.use: to re-stock missing items in her shop.

loans.name: Turizeranye Group

texts.fr:
Isadora est une commerçante de boutique (savons, riz, sel, haricôt, etc) depuis4 ans, âgé de54 ans.
Il habite à Songa et il est marié à Juvénal. Le couple a 1 enfant de 28 ans, il est fonctionnaire. Isadora a étudié jusqu’en 6è  année primaire.
Avant de se lancer dans son activité actuelle, elle était vendeuse de bière industrielle et Fanta.
Le crédit kiva qu’il bénéficie, lui permet d’augmenter son capital, il pourra augmenter la quantité d’articles de sa boutique (savons, riz, haricôt, sel, etc)
Il est membre du groupe communautaire « Turizeranye ».
texts.en:
Isidora has been a shopkeeper (soaps, rice, salt, beans, etc.) for 4 years. She is 54 years old. She lives in Songa and she is married to Juvénal. The couple has one 28-year-old child who is a civil servant. Isadora studied up to the 6th year of primary school. Before beginning her current business, she sold industrial beer and Fanta. 

The loan from which she is benefitting will allow her to increase her capital. She will be able to increase the number of items in her shop (soaps, rice, beans, salt, etc.). She is a member of the Turizeranye community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital and be able to increase the number of items in her shop (soaps, rice, beans, salt, etc.).

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 28 years old and single. To earn a living, he runs a butcher shop. He has been in the business for 4 years and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business and save his money. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested for 50,000 KES to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida is a 32-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been selling fish in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Saida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is 49 years old and is married to Mary. They have six children.

He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years, from which he earns a monthly income of Kes  30,000. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He hopes to use the funds to buy seeds and pesticides for spraying in his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд житель района Шахритус. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его отец работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en: Mahmud is a resident of the Shahritus district. He is 26 years old, married and has one infant. His father works in the orchard farm. On his own, he is engaged in raising cattle, an activity he has pursued for six years. He is taking a loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is married with 3 children. 

Gina has a coco lumber sales business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to pay for a business permit to the municipal hall. 

Gina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to pay for a business permit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Ramulate

texts.en: Ramulate is a 31-year-old married woman with three children, all of them in school. She has had a business selling fish in Kator, South Sudan, for the past five year. Ramulate is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 56-year-old business lady; she is married to Kamuya. They are blessed with four children aged 21, 18, 16 and 12 years respectively. She has been running a green grocer store for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Telesia will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Djanybek

texts.ru: Джаныбек 53-летний фермер, женат, воспитывает пятерых детей.  В 1996 году, в поисках доходов для своей семьи, Джаныбек решился на свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Джаныбека, начатое с суммы в 4,500 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. Также он возделывает 4,16 га земли с картофелем и зерновыми культурами.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Джаныбек обратился в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Джаныбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Djanybek is a 53-year-old farmer who is married with five children. In 1996, in a search for income for his family, Djanybek decided to start his own business in farming and field work. Thanks to his tenacity and perseverance, Djanybek took the starting household sum of 4,500 Som (KGS) and today brings in about 6,000 Som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. He also cultivates 4.16 hectares of land with potatoes and cereal grains. 

In order to further increase the number of his livestock, Djanybek applied to the Bai Tushum and Partners company for a loan in the amount of 45,000 Som (KGS) for the purchase of additional heads of livestock. Djanybek plans to use income from the loan to invest further and increase the number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en: Sreyneang is 41 years old and lives in a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. For more than a decade, she has earned a living as a farmer. She has six children, three of whom are dependents and work on the family farm while also attending school. Sreyneang received a loan from VisionFund one year ago, repaid it fully and on time and now earns around $7 per day and saves $3 daily. She leads a group of five women who are requesting a new loan from VisionFund. Sreyneang will use a portion of this loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crop and buy fertilizer. She hopes to grow enough rice to keep her children in school and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to improve the output of a rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Medina

texts.en: Medina is 39 years old, married and has earned a living for the last two years by selling clothing in Kator, South Sudan. She is applying for this loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the extra income earned as a result of this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken and pigs for commercial rearing.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is 23 years old, single and has six years' experience selling cosmetics. He works from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except Saturday. He is applying for a loan from Kiva to buy more cosmetics to sell. Francois will use the profits from this loan to meet his family's basic needs and start saving for his future. Someday he hopes to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Emile

texts.en:
Emile is 27-years-old and is single. He owns a business of supplying furniture. This is his second year in this business and he works from 8am until 6pm every day except on Sunday. He currently employs two people to help him.

Emile has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more furniture for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more furniture for resale.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
maimouna  agée de 37 ans habite dans région du sud du sénégal,mariée avec 4 enfants dont 3 sont à l'école.
Le fils ainé fait la classe seconde le 2em est en classe de 3em et le 3em fait la 6em secondaire.
Maimouna depuis son mariage travailler dans des rizière et fait la volaille en meme temps pour nourrire sa famille car son mari ne travail pas.Avec ce crédit,elle achète des poussins pour agrandire son poulailler qui est une activité tres rentable chez elle.
Maimouna habite dans une maison en location elle souhaite dans l'avenir etre dans sa propre maison;
texts.en: Maimouna is 37 years old and lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. The eldest son is in second grade (of the Senegalese school system), the second in third grade and the third in sixth grade of secondary school. Maimouna has been working in rice mills since she got married and also raises poultry in order to feed her family, since her husband does not work. With this loan she is going to buy chicks to expand her henhouse; this is a very profitable activity for her. Maimouna lives in a house which she rents but would like to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to strengthen funds

loans.name: Umjima

texts.en: Umjima is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling tea in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Umjima is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en: Ruel is a 35-year-old father of three children, ages 2, 4, and 6. He works as a seaweed farmer in Trinidad, Bohol. Ruel works hard to improve his earnings and sustain his family. He has requested this loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straws, and wooden pegs. Ruel hopes this loan will help improve his business. He also hopes to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straws, and wooden pegs.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 35-year-old business lady and a single mother of one child who is 12 years old. She has been a tailor for the past six years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Beth is applying for her fourth loan from KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy clothing materials for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hope is to open a beauty salon, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy horticultural products for the shop.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 29-year-old businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes in Kongowea, Mombasa. She is a single mother of one child.  She has been running a second hand clothes retail stall for the last three years and she is doing great. 

This will be Monica's second business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more secondhand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand shirts, skirts, blouses, and trousers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plasticware plus seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Proem's Group

texts.en:
Proem is 28 years old, married, and lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has two dependent children who are still in school. She has been farming rice as her main income source to support her living for more than four years. Sometimes, Proem and her husband work for others to raise extra income to better support their family. 

Now she leads a group of four female members in the village. Her group has been with VisionFund since 2010. She currently earns US $6 per day and is able to afford sufficient food for her family. She is requesting another loan with the other three members. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay for a water pump to carry water to her rice paddy. This loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully, and she hopes it will increase her crop yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for a water pump for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a 25 year old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for one year.
Lily is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 33-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has worked selling home products for five years. Bilal used to work in a hotel, but he insisted on running his own business, which will help a lot in improving his standard of living.
Bilal is a hard worker who is well known in his region. Most of his customers are friends, neighbors and retail shops. His business is growing, but it needs an external push to move forward. That's why Bilal has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with new home products collections.
Bilal hopes to open a big wholesale store and expand it to offer many useful household goods affordable to anyone.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with new home products collections.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Samuel and they are blessed with three children. 
Jane has been running a retail shop for the past three years. She makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her fourth loan with Kiva partner KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. Jane will use this loan to buy stocks of sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and open a wholesale shop, which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her son’s barbershop. He is a hair dresser by profession and offers shaving and hair cutting services to his customers. With the loan investment, he will buy creams, scissors, and other hairdressing tools to improve his business. He is very experienced, and Ghulam Fatima is confident that he will make good use of the loan and improve his business and income.

Ghulam Fatima is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She has 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her younger daughter also sews clothes and financially contributes to the family. Ghulam Fatima wants to provide a dowry for her elder daughter’s marriage, and she is hopeful that by improving her son's business, she will be able to save some money for that purpose.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Ghulam Fatima.

loans.use: To buy creams, scissors, and other hairdressing tools for a barbershop.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 57-year-old single woman with two children. She has been running a greengrocery for the past five years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.
Lucia is applying for her first loan with Kiva partner KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET client. Lucia will use the loan to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and open a retail shop, which will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a stock of green vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 35-year-old, married woman with 6 children, 5 of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for 4 years. Halima is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki Athmani is a 44-year-old widow and a mother of three children. She has been running a grocery business for the last ten years.
This is the third loan Riziki has taken to finance her business since she was introduced to Kiva partner KADET. She plans to buy tomatoes, kale, cabbages, onions and carrots to sell to the residents of Kaloleni. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. 
Riziki hopes to have a prosperous family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kale, cabbages, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Warlita buys and sells fish in her community. She also sells seaweed on the mainland. Warlita works hard to help her husband provide for their needs. She has requested this loan to buy more seaweed and fish to sell. Warlita hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes that her children are able to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed and fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three gorgeous children for whom she works hard to provide a good and healthy life. Nabiha is a woman with a good reputation. She works hard to help her husband provide for their family. 
Nabiha opened a shoe shop in 2004. Since that time, Nabiha has added several things to sell in her shop, such as toys and stationery, in order to attract customers' attention to things they might need.
Nabiha has been a borrower from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for two cycles. Her previous loan had a positive impact on her family, and she's very optimistic about this one, too. She hopes to expand her business in the future and open separate shops for the three business sectors.

loans.use: to increase her autumn/winter collection.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 27-year-old clothes dealer from Mombasa. She is married.
Ruth has been selling clothes for the last two years and she is doing great. This loan is her first to expand her business since she was introduced to Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more bales of clothes. Ruth will use the anticipated profits to build up capital for her business. 
She plans to further expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya. She has been farming for 5 years and produces potatoes, maize, kale, and tomatoes for the local market. She also runs a motorcycle transport business.

Grace has requested a loan of KES 63,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to improve her dairy  business by buying more cows. She adds that her family living standards improved with her improved income.

Grace sees the high costs of inputs as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph Otieno

texts.en: Joseph, 36 years old, is married and has three children ranging from 5 to 13 years. He describes himself as a hard-working man. He has been involved in poultry business for the last 11 years. He sells eggs and chicken to retailers. His business challenge is a shortage of chickens. He will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more chicks and broilers. Joseph wants to expand his business in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To buy chicks and broilers.

loans.name: Fouisseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur FOUISSEYNI est né  en 1979 à Sanzana préfecture de SIKASSO. Père d’un garçon et marié à une femme, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à  LOULOUNI (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Il mène les activités d’achats et de ventes des ustensiles de ménage et divers articles tous en plastique depuis plus de 6 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes, notamment des tasses, assiettes, bouilloires, seaux, baignoires etc. 
Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il est rentré en  collaboration avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso y’a plus de 3 ans.Il  est a son sixième prêt maintenant et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des tasses, bouilloires, assiettes, baignoires et louches en plastique. Il s’approvisionne à SIKASSO. Acheminé à LOULOUNI, Les articles sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à Loulouni et ses villages environnants. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fouisseyni was born in 1979 in Sanzana in Sikasso prefecture. He is married and father to one boy, and he lives in a traditional family in Loulouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

He has been running a business buying and selling kitchenware and various other articles, all plastic, for more than six years. His experience in this field has earned him a good reputation and he receives orders notably for cups, plates, kettles, buckets and bathtubs etc. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy customer demand he began his collaboration with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, more than three years ago. He is now on his sixth loan and all five previous loans were repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to buy plastic cups, kettles, plates, bathtubs and ladles. He gets his supplies in Sikasso. Once they have been transported to Loulouni, the goods are stored in his shop. He resells them for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women in Loulouni and the surrounding villages.

With this loan he is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA. This profit will allow him to repay the interest on his loan and the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar  est né vers 1980 à Bananso préfecture de KADIOLO, il vit avec son épouse et leurs deux garçons à LOULOUNI dans la  troisième région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Monsieur  Oumar  fait des prestations de services avec les activités de réparation des mobylettes et bicyclettes. En plus il mène également les activités d’achat et de vente de pièces détachées. 
Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso et à Bamako, acheminées à Loulouni les pièces sont stockées dans une boutique au garage à gauche du goudron près du dispensaire.Il vend au comptant et en détail.
Il est en collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux  ans, il est à son deuxième prêt et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.  
Il compte acheter, des jantes, des rayons, des pistons, des joints, des pédales et des chambres à air. 
 Il compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 FCFA, permettra de mieux faire face aux dépenses familiales,  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et le reste sera investis dans son activité.
Dans l’avenir il envisage d’ouvrir un magasin digne de ce nom avec un hangar d’où il travaillera.
texts.en:
Oumar was born around 1980 in the Bananso prefecture of Kadiolo. He lives with his spouse and their two sons in Loulouni in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

Oumar has a business providing service and reparing mopeds and bicycles. He also manages the buying and selling of parts. He gets his supplies in Sikasso and in Bamako, heading for Loulouni the parts are stocked in a shop in the garage to the left of the asphalt near the community clinic. He sells for cash and retail. 

He has been collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years; he is on his second loan and the previous loan was correctly repaid. 

He plans to buy wheel rims, spokes, pistons, joints, pedals and inner tubes. He plans to make an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA with this loan, which will allow him to better take care of family expenses. Part will be used to pay the interest on his loan and the rest will be invested in his business. In the future he envisions opening a store deserving of this name with a shed where he will work.

loans.use: to buy parts.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon, 66, a mother of three children, generates her income by cultivating rice crops from Baray district. She typically earns an average of $2.50 per day and tries to support her family. Her husband also assists her in farming. These days Suon is very busy with her work in the field, which includes harvesting and threshing her rice. Her rice fields are a bit far away from home, so it is difficult to transport her finished rice home without a trailer. Thus, Suon would like to ask for her first loan to purchase a trailer to better the way she is working. She hopes that our lenders will support her family towards and success in her career.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Guediouma

texts.fr:
Monsieur GUEDIOUMA  est né vers 1970 à KAMBO dans la préfecture de KADIOLO. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à KADIOLO (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène les activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 5 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment de maïs. Afin d’avoir les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire sa clientèle, il collabore avec l’Institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui , il est à son premier prêt.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 3 tonnes et 1/2 de maïs. Il s’approvisionne à KAMBO et ses villages avoisinants. Les céréales sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend en gros au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Guediouma was born around 1970 in Kambo in the Kadiolo prefecture. Father to five children he lives in a traditional family in Kadiolo (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

He has been managing a business marketing cereals for more than five years. His experience in this domain has brought him a good reputation and he receives orders for cereals, notably corn. 

In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy his clientèle, he is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his first loan. This loan will allow him to buy 3 1/2 tons of corn. He gets his supplies in Kambo and its neighboring villages. The cereals are stored in his store. He resells them wholesale for cash to a clientèle made up of men and often transports the cereals to Sikasso as needed. 

With this loan, he envisions making an average monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Salicou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  SALICOU  est né en 1985 à Dioumaténé préfecture de KADIOLO et il réside à Kadiolo  dans une famille monogame.
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, Monsieur  SALICOU  décide de mener les activités d’achats et de ventes de téléphones portables, façades et autres accessoires et le transfert d’unité il y a 5 ans. Il s'approvisionne à Bamako sur commande. Acheminé à Kadiolo, les produits sont stockés dans une boutique au marché, il vend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et femmes . 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Il compte acheter des téléphones portables et une quantité importante d'accessoires :  batteries et façades.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA dont  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et l’autre partie sera investis dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste dans la ville de Kadiolo.
texts.en:
Salicou was born in 1985 in Dioumaténé, Kadiolo prefecture and he lives in Kadiolo in a monogamous family. 

After having run many businesses without success, Salicou decided to manage a business buying and selling cell phones, cases and other accessories and the transfer of units five years ago. He gets his supplies in Bamako by order. Dispatched to Kadiolo, the products are stocked in a shop in the market. He sells for cash to a clientèle made up of men and women. 

To satisfy his increasingly growing clientèle, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan. He plans to buy cell phones and a significant quantity of accessories: batteries and cases. 

He envisions making an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA with this loan, of which one part will be used to pay the interest on his loan and the other part will be invested in his business. He plans to become a wholesaler in the town of Kadiolo.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Stephen Wandera

texts.en: Stephen is 45 years old, married and has four children ranging from five to twelve years old. He describes himself as a focused and understanding man. He sells products such as sugar, soap, cooking fat, flour etc. to hotels, restaurants and residents. He is also employed, which adds to his income. His business challenge is insufficient funds. Stephen will use his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more flour and cooking oil. Stephen's dream and hope is to run a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem is 31-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray district and earns a living by selling many different kinds of toys in various towns. She earns $2.50 a day to meet her family’s needs and help pay the cost of sending her one child to a local primary school. Yem wants to improve her living standards by helping her husband provide transportation services by driving a tuck-tuck (or small motorized vehicle). She is applying for this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a tuck tuck for her husband. She hopes to use the additional income earned by her family to expand and improve her toy-selling business.

loans.use: to buy a tuck tuck for her husband.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame  SALIMATA est née vers 1956 à Sikasso. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs deux enfants  à Noumousso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Kadiolo ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  SALIMATA, fait la commercialisation de pagnes wax  et de tasses il y a plus de 20 ans. Elle mène son activité dans sa famille au quartier Noumousso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits et de sa crédibilité. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le prêt précédent a été correctement bien remboursé. 
Elle compte acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax et quelques douzaines de tasses auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA dont  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et l’autre partie sera épargnée.
texts.en: Mrs. SALIMATA was born in 1956 in Sikasso. She lives with her spouse and their two children in Noumousso, one of the working-class neighborhoods of Kadiolo (the third largest administrative region in Mali).  Mrs. SALIMATA has been selling Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and cups for over 20 years.  She conducts business from home in the area of Noumousso where she is sought after by her clients for the quality of her products and her credibility.  To satisfy her growing customer base, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance organization.  She is on her second individual loan.  Her prior loan was fully repaid.  She plans to buy 15 pieces of Wax pagnes and a few dozen cups from wholesalers.  She makes her sales for cash and credit to customers who are primarily women.  She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 75 000 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay the interest on her loan.  The other part will be saved.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Njombu

texts.en:
He was born in May 1983. He is happily married with one child who is under 15 years of age, and they live in a one-room house. The death of his father when he was as young as seven and the theft of his truck are some of the difficult times he has encountered in life. He faced the challenge of the death of his father which caused him to be homeless since he is from a polygamous home.

He join GHAPE in 2009.  He has manage and successfully repaid a loan. He used the profit to expand his business and take care of his family and saved the rest for rainy days. His business is located at hospital roundabout where he sells provisions like savon [soap], sardines, drinks, sweets, sugar. He believes that, if the loan is given to him, his business will succeed because he will stock more goods which will attract more customers. He has done this business for a long time and has so many customers and the experience needed – this makes him believe that the business will be a success. Furthermore, people from the community will be relieved of the stress of moving from one area to another looking for goods, since many things will be available in his store.

The profit from the loan will be used to buy a plot of land and build a house for himself and to support his family. He will save the rest.He  prefers a loan from GHAPE because they have low interest rates and provide ample time for repayment.

loans.use: to buy savon, sardines, biscuits and sweets

loans.name: Review Tabitha Wanja

texts.en:
Tabitha Wanja is a 49-year-old business lady who runs a food kiosk in Bamburi, Mombasa. 

She is married and has been running this business for the last ten years and she is doing great. She was introduced to KADET and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour for her food kiosk. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business more. 

She hopes to own a big hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 48-years-old, married and the father of three children.

He has been operating a food kiosk for the past four years and he is doing great. This marks his second loan since he was introduced to KADET and will be used to expand his business. He will use the loan to open another food kiosk.

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and he hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: to open another food kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sausages and cooking oil and fill her gas stove

loans.name: Muniraan's Group

texts.en:
Muniraan has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is a salesman. With the loan investment, he will purchase biscuits  candies in bulk quantity and of different variety at wholesale rates. This will allow him increase his profits by selling the items at a profit.

He started this business many years ago. He collects orders from different bakeries and general stores and fulfills their orders to earn an income. 
Muniraan is hopeful that an investment will help her husband earning more income.

She is a housewife and spends her time doing her household responsibilities.

She has given birth to 3 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are illiterate and stay at home. Due to financial constraints, Muniraan couldn’t educate them.
Her eldest daughter is 25 years old and she is hopeful that she will be able to save some profits for her marriage as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and candies at wholesale rates for selling at a profit.

loans.name: C13018 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 28 years old and has one child who is 5 years old. She sells charcoal from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She is the leader of the group called "C13018 Twitezimbere" in the local language. Francoise has 5 years of experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more charcoal to sell. With the profit, Francoise will be able to reinvest in her business and to pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 48-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working as a blacksmith for the last 34 years. This long experience helped a lot in improving his business and providing him with a special talent. Khaled is a hardworking man and he works hard to provide his family with the best living possible.

Just like anyone who insists on improving his business, Khaled applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because his last experience with Al Majmoua was impressive and he is optimistic too about this one. This time Khaled is willing to buy updated tools and machines necessary for making his work easier.

Khaled is sure that through this loan, he will be capable of providing good living for his family. Khaled hopes to keep on improving his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy updated tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buys shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan, 46 years of age, is very active and operates a decorative embroidery business from her home. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and fills the orders on time to earn an income. Rasoolan has 4 sons; the eldest is a laborer and the others are studying.

Rasoolan's husband has a business selling animals. He purchases sheep and goats at a young age, raises them and sells them to butchers once they become healthy and older. Rasoolan has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy sheep and goats in larger numbers for reselling at a profit. He has been operating his business for many years and Rasoolan is confident of his business success after investing this loan.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Review Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 29-year-old food kiosk owner in Mombasa. 

He is single and has been operating this business for the past three years and he is doing great. This marks his third borrowing  to finance his business since he was introduced to KADET. He plans to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour for his food kiosk. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business more and hopes to own a bigger hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, baking flour, beans, maize and maize flour

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s animals selling business. By utilizing the loan, he will buy goats and sheep of a young age, grow them up and sell them for a profit to butchers and also on EID season. Her husband is a very dedicated person and loves his animals and takes care of them very well.

Naseem, in her spare time, provides full support to her husband by taking care of the animals. She is also a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients for profits. She has given birth to 3 sons. Her eldest son is illiterate while the other 2 are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Naseem is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his income and she will be able to continue giving education to her children.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married and has two children, aged six and eight years. He describes himself as a self-motivated and assertive man. He has been selling herbal and manufactured medicines to retailers and wholesalers who are his primary customers. He has been in this activity for eight years now. His business challenge is the disturbance from the municipal council due to required licenses which he says are on high in cost. He will use the loan 20,000 Kes to buy one hundred packets of Letrax (veterinary products) and one hundred cartons of herbal soap and medicine. 

John's hope and goals are to increase the number of his customers and stock within the next five years and also to be importing most of his medicine.

loans.use: To buy 100 packets of Letrax and 100 cartons of herbal soap and medicine.

loans.name: Willineth

texts.en:
Willineth is a 38-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 2 and 17. Her husband is a fisherman.

Willineth sells fresh fish to her community. She also sells dried seaweed on the mainland. She plans to use her loan to purchase more fish and seaweed to sell. 

Willineth does her best to feed her family and improve their living situation. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Mamadou Lamine

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 3 enfants dont 1 fréquente l'école arabe.Il exerce les activités d'agriculture et de commerce.Il vend des habits pour enfants et des chaussures.Il pratique cette activité depuis près de 10 ans et arrive à prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son commerce.Il est sociétaire de l'UIMCEC et a déjà payé sans retard et en avance 3 prêts de deux fois 500 000 et de 250 000f.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un nouveau pret de 300000f pour acheter 4 caisses de chaussures et 12 douzaines d'habits. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'import - export et d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, father of 3 children, 1 of which attends Arabic school.  He works in farming and business. He sells children's clothing and shoes.  He has been in this business for almost 10 years and manages to take care of his family's expenses with the revenues from his work.  He is a member of UIMCEC and has already repaid 3 loans without delay and in advance: two of 500,000 fr each and one of 250,000 fr.  To strengthen his business, he is requesting a new loan of 300,000 fr to buy 4 cases of shoes and 12 dozen clothes.  His goal is to get into the import-export business and to expand his activities.

loans.use: to buy 4 cases of shoes and 12 dozen clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock feed.

loans.name: Majeeda Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Majeeda bibim, 33 years old, lives with her family, a husband and four children who are 17, 13, 8 and 5 years old.  
She owns and operates a sewing business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. Her client base is her community members who prefer taking her services due to the quality of her work and reasonable rates. 
Besides her sewing, she also gives proper time to her household work and fulfills the requirements of her family. 
Her husband is a very hardworking person by nature. He operates his fruit selling business in the market and generates income for the family. 
He is very ambitious and wants to grow his business. 
That is why Majeeda has applied for a loan with Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal fruits in larger quantity to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 36 years old and married. He has been operating a food kiosk business for the past two years. This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the loan to buy more cooking oil, frying pans, and baking flour. 

He will use the anticipated profits to build up capital for his business to expand his business further.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, frying pans, and baking flour.

loans.name: Shahzad's Group

texts.en:
Shahzad is married and has four sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons work while the others are getting their education.
Her husband is a professional cook and offers his services at different parties and marriage ceremonies. He cooks food of great taste which his customers like very much.
Shahzad is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great sewing skills and her sewed clothes are in good demand in her community.
She has applied for a loan with KIVA partner Asasah to improve her husband's cooking business. 
With the loan investment, he will buy large pots for his business. This will help him making larger quantities of food and increase his profits.
He is an experienced business person and has been operating his business for the past many years.
Shahzad is hopeful that an investment will be more beneficial for him.

loans.use: To buy pots for food production business.

loans.name: Elimane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 3 enfants dont l'un est élève à l'école primaire.Il exerce dans la menuiserie métallique depuis près de 12 ans.Il achète du fer forgé et confectionne des lits, des tables et d'autres articles qu'il revend à ses clients. Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus assez substantiels qui lui permettent de prendre en charge son épouse et ses trois enfants. Pour améliorer ses revenus, il sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter du fer forgé et des accessoires.Son ambition est de transformer son atelier en entreprise.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, and has 3 children, one of whom goes to primary school. He has been into metalwork for about 12 years. He buys wrought iron which he uses to make beds, tables, and other items, which he sells to his customers. He gains a substantial income from this occupation, which enables him to provide for his wife and his 3 children. To increase his income, he is applying for a 500000f loan, so he can buy wrought iron as well as some accessories. His ambition is to turn his workshop into a company.

loans.use: to buy wrought iron as well as some accessories.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius  is a 26-year-old greengrocer in Bamburi, Mombasa. 

He is married and the father of two children.  He has been operating a green grocery stall for the past two years and he is doing great. Since he was introduced to KADET, this marks his second loan to finance his business. 

He plans to purchase more fruit, kales, cabbages, and onions to sell to the residents of Bamburi. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children. 

He hopes to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, kale, cabbages, and onions.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has three children ranging in age from four through nine years. She has been selling khat for the last three years.  She is also a farmer. 
 
The business is in a conducive and good area. Her business challenges are insufficient funds and shortages of khat. She will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more khat and banana leaves for wrapping khat. 

Lucy's hope and dream is to run a bigger khat business.

loans.use: to purchase more khat and banana leaves.

loans.name: Luckystar Group

texts.en: This is Mary. She is 51 years old, married with seven children, and lives in the “city of progress” called Gweru in Zimbabwe and is into the poultry and retail business of selling clothes and blankets. Three of her children still attend school. Mary has one dependent living with her who also still attends school. She has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy chicks, chicken feed, blankets for her poultry project and flea market business. With the income from this loan she will be able to improve her business performance and return a bit more income for investment into other ventures . She says the challenges faced in her business are bad debtors who sometimes fail to make payments for the items bought on credit. She is planning to invest into more businesses that might benefit her community by reducing poverty .

loans.use: To buy chicken, chicken feed, blankets and comforters for flea markets.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr:
Aline fait le commerce des habits. Elle a 33 ans. Aline est marée et a 3 enfants dont le plus petit a 10 mois et le plus grand a 14 ans. Deux enfants d'Aline vont à l'école. Elle a 6 ans d'enseignements secondaires.

C'est le 2ème cycle de crédit qq'Aline fait avec ACB Ltd. Elle veut augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.

Dans le futur, Aline veut devenir grossiste par ce qu'actuellement elle vend en detail. Pour y arriver, elle va augmenter son capital d'une façon continue et cherchera beaucoup de clients.

Avec le profit de son commerce, Aline va construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Aline trades in clothing. She is 33 years old. Aline is married and has three children of whom the youngest is 10-months old and the eldest is 14. Two of Aline's children go to school. She has six years of secondary school.

This is the second loan cycle that Aline is requesting from ACB Ltd. She wants to increase the capital of her business selling clothing.

In the future, Aline wants to become a wholesaler because presently she sells retail. In order to make it happen, she is going to increase her capital in a continuous way and will look for many customers. With her business' profits, Aline is going to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants and t-shirts to resell

loans.name: Bara

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune, célibataire qui s'active dans l'achat, la réparation et la vente de véhicules.Il est dans ce secteur depuis près de 10 ans.Avec les bénéfices tirés de son activité, il prend en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses deux parents qui sont à sa charge.Pour améliorer ses revenus, il sollicite un prêt de 300000f pour réparer un véhicule en achetant 4 portes et des accessoires.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a young single man who is into buying, repairing, and selling vehicles. He's been in this business for about 10 years. With the profits gained from this activity, he provides for himself and his two dependent parents. To increase his income, he is applying for a 300000f loan so he can buy 4 doors and some accessories which he needs to fix a vehicle. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 doors and some accessories

loans.name: Kimheat's Group

texts.en:
A rural dweller from a village located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Kimheat is 31 years old and has two dependent children who are still in school. She is a farmer and also sells groceries in front of her house to make a living. She has been in this business for several years. She currently earns US$5 per day and is able to save US$2.5 per day.

There are three members in Kimheat's group. She and Neang are the first cycled clients while Pov has been with VisionFund since 2010. Now Kimleat leads this group in applying for a loan with VisionFund. She will use the entire loan of US$300 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and also buy some grocery items e.g., shampoo, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. for her store. She hopes this loan will help her increase her business and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and some groceries.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Edith
