texts.en: Edith is married and has two children aged six months and 1. She describes herself as an optimistic woman. She has run a grocery store selling onions, mangoes and bananas for the last three years. Her business challenge is a shortage of stock. She will be using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more oranges, mangoes and onions. Edith plans to expand her business into wholesale in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more oranges, mangoes and onions.

loans.name: Ochirsuren

texts.en:
Ochirsuren is 44 years old and makes a living as a professional driver. He lives with his wife and two children, who are 16 and 18, in a small house in Mongolia’s capital, Ulaanbaatar. Both of his children attend college, so the family has to pay high school fees. 
Ochirsuren has supported his family by operating a transportation business since 2003. His wife helps him in his transportation business and they both work hard because they are determined to provide their children with a good education. 
Ochirsuren has run his business by using the family minivan. He has permission to carry passengers in one of the city’s remote areas, which lacks a bus service. As his business is very popular in Mongolia, he wants to buy one more minivan. So he is requesting a 1,600,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase one more minivan. He is a trusted and repeat client of Kiva partner Transcapital Co. Ltd., and he is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving him an opportunity to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy parts to improve and repair his van.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.fr:
Philippe est cultivateur des maïs, haricots et sorgho.  Il a 28 ans et est encore célibataire sans enfant et sans une autre personne en charge. Il a fait 6 ans de l’école primaire.  

Il est client de l’ACB Ltd depuis 2007 et ce crédit est le 24ème auprès d’ACB Ltd.  Le crédit qu’il a demandé lui aidera d’acheter les semences de maïs et haricots, et le reste sera utiliser pour faire cultiver ses champs. 

Philippe veut être un cultivateur professionnel dans le futur. Pour se faire, il va utiliser des engrais chimiques et va accroître l’étendue des champs cultivable et fera son mieux pour mobiliser beaucoup de clients.

Le profit qu’il tirera dans son agriculture lui aidera de fonder son propre foyer.
texts.en:
Philippe is a corn, bean and sorghum farmer. He is 28 and is still single without children and without dependents. He completed six years of primary school.

He has been a client of ACB Ltd. since 2007 and this loan is the 24th with ACB Ltd. The loan which he has requested will help him to buy corn and bean seeds, and the rest will be used to cultivate his fields.

Philippe wants to be a professional farmer in the future. To make this happen, he is going to use chemical fertilizers and is going to grow the expanse of cultivable fields and will do his best to mobilize many customers. The profit that he will make in his farming will help him to set up his own home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cultivate his fields.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu  is a 55-year-old charcoal dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She also owns a motorcycle, which operates as a boda boda, to supplement her income.

Saumu is a widow and has been operating her business for the past four years. She is doing great. This is her third loan to finance her business since she was introduced to Kiva partner KADET. She plans to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale and repair her motorcycles. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and she hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and repair her motorcycles.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en:
Thida, 27, is a rural dweller in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district. She is a farmer who grows rice as her main income source to support her living. Sometimes, she works for others to raise extra income. She has two dependent children who are still in school. 

This is Thida's second group loan with VisionFund. Now she leads this group of four female members to apply for another loan. She currently earns US$4.5 per day and is able to save only US$2 daily. Now that she is requesting the loan, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and earn more income to afford nutritious food and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, sans enfant.Il est employé comme agent de sécurité dans une auberge de sa localité.En plus de cet emploi, il exerce un commerce de miel, d'huile de palm et de savon en poudre.Il a déjà bénéficié de trois prets de l'UIMCEC qu'il a payé sans retards. Son commerce lui permet d'avoir des revenus supplémentaires pour mieux entretenir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son commerce, il sollicite un nouveau prêt de 250 000 f pour acheter du miel et de l'huile de palm. Son ambition est d'élargir ses activités.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man with no children. He works as a security guard in a hostel in his area. In addition to this job, he sells honey, palm oil, and soap powder. He has already received 3 loans from UIMCEC, which he has paid back on time. With this business, he has an additional income, which allows him to better take care of his family. In order to strengthen his business, he is applying one more time for 250 000f, so he can buy honey and palm oil. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy honey and palm oil.

loans.name: Sop Sa Serigne Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sop sa serigne a été crée le 12 Mai 2010, Il est composé de 14 femmes issue de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Ngaya (Debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle fait la transformation de l'huile d'arachide. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement acheter un mouton et des arachides pour revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Sa Serigne was created on May 12, 2010. It is made up of 14 women from the same region. They practice the same business - the transformation of ground nuts into oil.

Ngaya (standing at the right in the photo) is responsable for the group. She is 42 years old. She is married and mother to two children. She transforms ground nuts into oil.

With her loan, she is going to increase her level of supplies, buy a sheep and ground nuts to resell. Her profits will allow her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and ground nuts.

loans.name: Phalany's Group

texts.en:
Phalany is a 48-year-old grocery seller living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. She has been earning a living in this business for several years. She has three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She currently earns less than US$5 per day and is able to save only around US$2 daily. 

This is Phalany's first group loan with VisionFund. She leads this group in applying for a loan. She will use the entire loan to pay her children's tuition. She hopes this loan will keep her children in school until graduation.

loans.use: To pay her children's tuition.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is married and has two children aged two and six.  He describes himself as an ambitious and optimistic man.  He has been selling electronics for the last four years.  Previously he was involved in farming.  His business challenge is the high cost of electronics. 

He will be using the loan KES 20,000 to purchase more electronics.  Stanley hopes and plans to have diversified his business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more electronics.

loans.name: Engly's Group

texts.en:
Engly, 47, is a farmer in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district while her husband is a village chief. They have three children, two of whom are dependents. She currently earns less than US$4 per day from her current business and is able to save only US$1 daily. 

This is Engly's first group loan with VisionFund. She and her member Sokleng are applying for a loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy rice and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 3 Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la gestión de una de las miembros. Ella, al enterarse sobre el programa de la Fundación, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas emprendedoras para formar el comité en la zona. Mujeres Unidas 3 se llama , en a las señoras muy solidarias y cooperadoras, están en el Cuarto Ciclo con 11  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que siempre están pendiente de cualquier tema, pues les interesa mucho.
Una de las miembros es la señora Zunilda, quien tiene una Despensa. Ella comenta que tiene un negocio bien surtido, el cual la ayuda a poder tener los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia y su casa. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder tener mayores ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos de primera necesidad. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to the efforts of one of its members. Upon hearing about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya, she contacted her neighbors and friends who are entrepreneurs in order to establish a local committee. This group is called “Mujeres Unidas 3” (United Women 3), a group of united and cooperative ladies who are in their eleventh loan cycle with 11 members. They are a unified, supportive, and responsible group and possess a great entrepreneurial spirit. All of them are always aware of any issue and take great interest in each one.

One of the members is Sra. Zunilda, who manages a food pantry. She says that she has a well-stocked business, which helps her to have the income necessary to help her family and her household. One of her goals is to continue growing and generating more income. Zunilda is requesting a loan to restock her business with food products, beverages, baked goods, dairy goods, and other basic necessities. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, baked goods, dairy goods, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.fr:
Viateur fait le commerce des poules. Il a 42 ans, marié et ayant 3 enfants. L’enfant  le mois âgé a 3 ans et le plus âgé a 11 ans. Il a une personne en charge. Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école. Viateur a 8 ans de primaire.
C’est le premier cycle de crédit que Viateur fait avec ACB Ltd. Il va utiliser le crédit pour acheter en grande quantité des poules.
Viateur veut être le fournisseur des poules dans toute la région. Pour y arriver, il a une stratégie d’augmenter son capital pour acheter les poules en grande quantité.
Avec le profit, Viateur se propose d’éduquer ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Viateur sells hens. He is 42 years old, married and has three children. The youngest child is 3 and the oldest 11 years old. He has one dependent. Two of his children go to school. Viateur completed eight years of primary school.

This is the first loan cycle that Viateur is requesting from ACB Ltd. He is going to use the loan to buy a large quantity of hens.

Viateur wants to supply hens to his entire region. To make it happen, he has a strategy to increase his capital to buy a large quantity of hens.

With the profit, Viateur is going to educate his children and take care of their health.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of hens.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
A rural villager located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Noeun is a 41 year-old mother of two dependent children. She and her husband have been farming on her farmland and planting cassava as a main income source for twenty years. With her current business, Noeun earns US$5 per day and is able to save US$2.5 daily. 

With a lack of money for her business, Noeun is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to hire workers to harvest her rice crops and cassava. This loan will enable her to harvest her crops timely, ready them for consumption, sell them to better support her living and set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Virgen De Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Virgen de Santa Inés” .Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya, ya que las mismas tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. El comité se encuentra en el Primer Ciclo con 12 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son  unidas responsables y solidarias las unas con las otras.
Rafaela es una de las miembros, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de pollos, comenta que le va muy bien, ya que los pollos se han convertido en una alternativa ya que la carne está muy cara. Dice que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus cientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Virgen de Santa Inés.”  The members are grateful for the opportunity Fundación Paraguaya is providing since they will have new opportunities to undertake better work contributing to family income and thus providing their children with improved wellbeing.  The committee is in its first cycle and has 12 members.  Each has her own productive activity.  They are united, responsible and mutually supportive with one another.

Rafaela is one of the members.  She tells us that she sells chickens and comments that she does very well because chicken has turned into an alternative to meat which is very expensive.  She says that thanks to this work she’s been able to get ahead and help her family and to cover daily expenses.

She asks for the loan to buy chickens to stock up and meet customer demand.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Sengheang's Group

texts.en:
Sengheang, 52 years old, is a rural dweller in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district who has been farming rice as her main income source. She has been in this business for 30 years to support her big family of five children. Two of the children are dependents and still in school. Sometimes, she works with others to raise additional income. 

Sengheang and her member Soknan has been with VisionFund since 2010. The first loan from VisionFund helped her to increase her family's income and rice crops. She currently earns up to US$5 per day. Now she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer for her farm and buy gasoline for her water pump, which will then carry water into her rice paddy. She hopes to grow more and more healthy rice. She also hopes to earn more income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and buy gasoline for the water pump on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en:
Rahman is a 43 year old man, IDP, who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last three years. He chose this business because it is profitable and a fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy and many national dishes are made of vegetable like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in an Azerbaijan family and can also be made into fresh punch.

Rahman sells his crop in the BIlasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN. His wife actively helps him raise crops.

As these products are in high demand, Rahman wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 800 AZN loan. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his 6th loan from AqroInvest and Rahman has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has two children aged six and twelve.  She is an optimistic woman.  She has been selling cereals such as maize, beans, black beans etc. for the last six years.  Her business is in a busy market.  Her business challenge is the high cost of cereals. 

She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cereals to add to her stock.  Regina hopes and plan to have diversified her business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase three cattle, one milkier cow and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two baby calves.

loans.name: Limheang's Group

texts.en:
Limheang, 42, is married and has three dependent children who are still in school. She is a farmer and she has been in this business for more than several years. With only one income source for the family, Limheang and her husband sometimes work for others to gain additional income to better support the family. 

Limheang has been with VisionFund for one year. The loan from VisionFund has significantly helped her family. Now she and another member Hie, who has been with VisionFund for only this year, are applying for a loan. Limheang wants to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her water pump to carry water into her rice farm for US$250. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow healthy rice and sell it for a good price to earn more income to better meet her family's basic needs and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy both fertilizer and gasoline for the water pump for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adelaïde Ayaba est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adelaïde Ayaba est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Adelaïde Ayaba n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Adelaïde Ayaba est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Alphonse. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adelaïde Ayaba vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Adelaïde Ayaba vend depuis une vingtaine d’année, divers produits, des céréales et des chaussures. Adelaïde Ayaba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adelaïde Ayaba sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe MAHUKPEGO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: MAHUKPEGO is a group composed of 2 people who live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Adelaïde Ayaba, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Adelaïde Ayaba is 46 and lives in Benin. Adelaïde Ayaba never went to school. She is married to a mechanic named Alphonse. They care for their 4 children, who all go to school. Adelaïde Ayaba lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, Adelaïde Ayaba has been selling miscellaneous items for about 20 years (cereal, shoes, etc). She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Adelaïde Ayaba, along with the other member of MAHUKPEGO, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy cereal and shoes.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and has a five-year-old daughter. She describes herself as an honest woman with integrity. She has been selling food products and basins for the last three years. Her business is in a conducive environment. In addition, Pamela provides motorcycle transportation. 
Pamela faces the challenge of insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more products such as flour, snacks, basins, etc. Pamela dreams of expanding her business and owning at least three motorcycles within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more products such as flour, snacks, basins, etc.

loans.name: Nico Vive Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se han unido 13 mujeres con muchas ganas y deseos de poder progresar y salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, comentan que tienen como objetivo obtener mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres luchadoras es Luz, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo. Comenta que tiene buena venta ya que las frutas que vende tiene muy buena salida. Ella se define como una mujer muy sacrificada, ya que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y vuelve a casa ya nuy tarde.
Luz solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser melones, sandias, ciruelas, manzanas, naranjas y demás, con las cuales podrá tener más variedad y productos frescos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Mariano Roque Alonso, thirteen women have united with tremendous willingness and desire to make progress and move forward. They are hardworking and determined women who say that their goal is to earn more income so that they can help their families.

One of these determined women is Luz, who sells all types of fruit. She says that she has had good fruit sales because she has gotten off to an excellent start. Luz defines herself as a very self-sacrificing woman. She begins each work day in the early morning hours and returns home very late. Luz is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, plums, apples, oranges, and other goods so that she can have more variety and fresh produce to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for eventual resale.

loans.name: Ognatan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OGNATAN est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Félicienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Félicienne est âgé de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Félicienne a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Félicienne est mariée à un certain Diallo. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Félicienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Félicienne vend depuis six ans, divers produits (conserves, etc.) dans une boutique au Bénin. Félicienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Félicienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OGNATAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: OGNATAN is a group composed of 2 friends who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Félicienne, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Félicienne is 36 and lives in Benin. She quit school at the primary level. Félicienne is married to a man named Diallo. They have one dependent child, who goes to school. Félicienne lives with her husband and her child. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, Félicienne has been selling miscellaneous items (canned food, etc.) in a shop in Benin. Félicienne buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Félicienne, along with the other members of OGNATAN, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items (canned food, etc.)

loans.name: Ngirankugire / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe NGIRANKUGIRE/RSZ. Il a 52 ans, marié et ayant 3 enfants dont le moins âgé a 15 ans et le plus âgé a 30 ans. Un seul enfant va à l'école. Jean a 3 personnes en charge. Jean a 3 ans de sécondaire.
C'est le 2ème cycle de crédit que Jean fait avec ACB Ltd. Avec le crédit, Jean va acheter beaucoup de manioc pour faire la farine qu'il vendra à ses clients.
Il a une stratégie d'avoir la bonne correspondance avec les clients, ce qui lui permettra d'être le fournisseur de farine des maniocs dans la région.
Avec le profit, il pretend éduquer ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Jean is part of the Ngirankugire/Rsz group. He is 52 years old, married and has three children of whom the youngest is 15 and the oldest 30 years old. Only one child goes to school. Jean has three dependents. Jean completed three years of secondary school.

This is the second loan cycle that Jean is requesting from ACB Ltd. With the loan, Jean is going to buy a lot of manioc to make flour which he will sell to his customers.

He has a strategy to have good correspondence with his customers, which will allow him to be the supplier of manioc in the region. With the profits, he plans to educate his children and take care of their health.

loans.use: to buy manioc stock.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda  is a 33-year-old retail shop owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is single and a mother of one child.
Emelda has been running retail shop for the last two years and she is doing great. She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET and this is her second loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase stocks of rice, cooking oil, maize flour and washing powder for her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her child. 
Emelda hopes to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, cooking oil, maize flour and washing powder.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has one daughter. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She has been running a general stall selling items such as basins, pans, belts, spoons, cups etc. for the last two years. She faces the challenge of the high cost of items. 
Mercy will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stocks of basins, cups, belts and pans. Mercy looks forward to expanding her business in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy stocks of basins, pans, cups and belts.

loans.name: Koeti Jave Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se han unido al programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, para que por medio de este puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son mujeres muy humildes, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar sus estilos de vida.
Ilda es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, el cual ha sido su medio de subsistencia y la de su familia, gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo diario tiene los medios suficientes para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Uno de sus sueños es tener un gran local donde pueda tener en exhibición las prendas que tiene.
Ilda solicita la ayuda de la fundación para poder comprar prendas de verano, ya que estamos en época de calor y quiere estar preparada para la demanda de los clientes. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Caaguazú have joined the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program so that they can help one another by working together. They are humble women, but they greatly want to succeed and improve their lifestyles.

Ilda is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells all types of clothing in order to support herself and her family. Thanks to her work and daily efforts, she has sufficient resources to help with the household expenses. One of her dreams is to have a large shop where she can display the clothes that she offers.

Ilda is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya so that she can buy summer clothing. Warmer weather has arrived, so she wants to be prepared to meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity being given to her.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tujinama Group

texts.fr:
Véronique est une commerçante âgée de 50ans qui habite à Masenga dans la province de Gitega. Elle vend du charbon et la bière de sorgho  depuis 6 ans. Elle a commence cette activité alors qu’elle faisait l’agriculture. Elle fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année primaire. Elle est mariée à Salvator. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter  des bananes pour la préparation de la bière à vendre afin de satisfaire les besoins de la famille. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire«Tujinama».
texts.en:
Véronique is a 50-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Masenga in the province of Gitega. She has been selling coal and sorghum beer for six years. She started this business when she was a farmer. She studied up until the fourth level of primary school. She is married to Salvator.

The Kiva loan that she gets will allow her to increase her capital to buy bananas to prepare beer to sell in order to satisfy the needs of her family.

She is a member of the community group Tujinama.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to buy bananas for the preparation of beer to sell.

loans.name: Javzandulam

texts.en:
Borrower Javzandulam is a 46 year old hardworking woman who lives with her husband and two sons in outer ger district, without basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her eldest son works as a packman while her other son attends a local university and their father works as a security man. 

She has supported her family by operating a small grocery store business since 2005. Currently she has 2.5 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Her small store is very popular in that location. During the Christmas and New Years holidays she needs more products to sell. Therefore, Javzandulam is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT to purchase necessary products such as ham, meat, foods and fruits.

loans.use: to purchase some products to sell during the holiday.

loans.name: Rondera B Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse est commerçante de banane, âgée de 51 ans. Elle habite à Rutegama et exerce son métier depuis 32 ans.Au paravent elle  pratiquait l’agriculture comme son mari Vital..Le couple a 7 enfants dont 4 étudient. Elle a étudié jusqu’en 4 année primaire .Elle  a déjà bénéficié trois crédits avec Turame.
Le crédit Kiva, lui permet d’augmenter son capital  pour acheter une  grande quantité de bananes à revendre afin de gagner plus.
Elle est membre du groupe  communautaire «  Rondera B »
texts.en:
Thérèse sells bananas. She is 51 years old. She lives in Rutegama and has been running her business for 32 years. Previously she was a farmer like her husband Vital. The couple has seven children of whom four study. She studied until the fourth year of primary school. 

She has already benefitted from three loans with Turame. This Kiva loan will allow her to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell in order to make more. She is a member of the community group Rondera B.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy a large quantity of bananas to resell in order to make more.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.fr:
Jonathan fait le commerce des cartes de téléphone de tigo ainsi que les cartes sim. Il a 31 ans, marié et ayant 2 enfants dont le plus petit a 1 an et le plus grand a 2 ans et 6 mois. Il a deux personnes en charge et aucun enfant ne va à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans primaire.
C’est le 1er cycle de crédit avec ACB Ltd. Il va utiliser le crédit demandé pour accroître son stock de téléphone.
Jonathan veut être le fournisseur des produits de tigo dans sa région. Pour se faire, il va faire son mieux pour avoir un stock suffisant des produits de tigo.
Avec le profit de son commerce, Jonathan va payer les frais de scolarité de ses petits frère et fera soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jonathan sells Tigo phone cards as well as SIM cards. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. The youngest is one year old and the oldest is two years and six months old. He has two dependents and neither child goes to school. His education level is six years of primary school.

This is his first loan cycle with ACB Ltd. He is going to use the requested loan to grow his stock of telephone cards.

Jonathan would like to be the supplier of Tigo products for his region. To make this happen, he is going to do his best to have a sufficient stock of Tigo products.

With his business' profits, Jonathan is going to pay for his younger brothers' school fees and take care of his children's health.

loans.use: to grow his stock of phone cards.

loans.name: Adrian Esteban

texts.es: El joven Adrián Esteban a sus 24 años de edad es un comerciante de ropa hogar, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta por encargo de cobijas, sabanas y cortinas, gracias a la experiencia adquirida en una distribuidora de estos productos en la cual trabajó. Con el ánimo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que en los últimos meses han pasado por dificultades económicas y de salud, el joven Adrián necesita de la compra de surtido que pueda ofrecer en pueblos y así aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y a futuro cumplir su sueño de tener una gran distribuidora de ropa hogar.
texts.en:
Adrián Esteban is a young man who is 24 years of age and a merchant who sells household linens. He has been selling blankets, bed sheets, and curtains for several years thanks to the experience he acquired working at a distribution center that carries these products. Adrián is motivated to improve his quality of life and that of his family. However, in recent months, he has experienced financial and health problems.

Young Adrián needs to buy inventory that he can offer to people so that he can increase his sales, improve his income, and fulfill his future dream of having a large household linen distribution business.

loans.use: to buy household linens such as blankets, bed sheets, and curtains.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is married and has five children aged from 26 to 37. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. She runs a general stall and sells items such as paper and plastic cups. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Teresia's business challenge is the high cost of items sold. She will be using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more paper and plastic cups. In the next five years, Teresia hopes and dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more paper and plastic cups.

loans.name: Alice Chirondo

texts.en:
Alice Chirondo is a 33-year-old posho mill owner in Mariakani. She is married and a mother of five children. Alice has been running this business for the past two years and she is doing great. 
Alice was introduced to Kiva partner KADET and this is her third loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase another posho mill and a motorcycle for business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and repay her loan. 
Alice hopes to do well and have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase another posho mill and a motorcycle.

loans.name: Dugar

texts.en:
Dugar is a 58 year old widower who lives with his daughter and son in a small house which is located in a outer ger district, without basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His son attends Mongolian University of Science and Technology. 

He has supported his family by operating a grocery store business for 6 years. The big advantage of his business is his small store is the only store in that that area, so he has many customers. He has about a 4.5 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. 

During the holiday he wants to increase his working capital and wants to attract more customers as well. Thus Dugar is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery products to sell. Also he is a very trusted client of Transcapital CoLtd.,

loans.use: to buy some grocery products to sell during the holiday.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo se han unido con la esperanza de poder formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Luego de interiorizarse decidieron formar su grupo, del cual surge el comité llamado Mujeres al Poder, donde todas las miembros trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperacion, respeto y mutua ayuda.
Una de las miembros es la señora María Fatima, quien se dedica a la venta de carbón, comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que el carbón últimamente se está usando mucho y es por ello que sus ventas van creciendo lo que a la vez le da muy buenos ingresos. Ella dice que trabaja mucho, pero que no le importa ya que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el préstamo para abastecerse con carbón, ya que no quiere quedar desabastecida, pues en este tiempo hay mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Nineteen women from the city of Coronel Oveido have gathered in hopes of joining the Program of Women Entrepreneurs through Fundación Paraguaya. After the internal decision was made to form a group, the members decided to call themselves “Mujeres al Poder” (Women of Power). All of the members work together in a spirit of cooperation, respect, and mutual assistance.

One of the members is Sra. María Fatima, who sells charcoal. She says that she has very good business since there has been great demand as of late. For this reason, her sales have been increasing and resulting in very good income. She says that she works hard, but it is important that all of her efforts focus on providing her family everything they need to have a decent and dignified life.

María Fatima is requesting a loan to restock her inventory of charcoal because she does not want to run out of her product during this time when there is great demand.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Songa Group

texts.en:
Selemani, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children who are still at school. He has been running a fruit and vegetable business since 2007. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 
This will be his second loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to increase his stock, pay school fees and meet household expenses, and he paid back his loan successfully. He wants a new loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. His dream is to one day be able to raise enough money to send his children to good schools.
Selemani will share this loan with his loan group "Songa," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Abakoranabushake/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Damascène fait le commerce général en détail (boutique). Il est membre du groupe ABAKORANABUSHAKE/RSZ. Il est marié et 4 enfants qui vont tous à l'école. Son âge est 38 ans, l'âge de son enfant le plus petit est 6 ans tandis que celui de son enfant le plus grand est 14 ans. Jean Damascène n'a aucune autre personne en charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 3 ans de secondaire.
C'est le 2ème cycle de crédit que Jean Damascène contracte auprès d'ACB Ltd. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter le capital de son commerce de boutique.
Il veut devenir grossiste. Pour y arriver, il va accroître son stock des marchandise.
Il va éduquer ses enfants dans le profit qu'il tirera dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Jean Damascène has a general retail business. He is a member of the Abakoranabushake/Rsz group. He is married and has four children who all go to school. His age is 38, the age of his youngest child is 6 while that of his eldest is 14. Jean Damascène has no other dependents. His level of education is three years of secondary school.

This is the second loan cycle that Jean Damascène is contracting from ACB Ltd. This loan will allow him to grow his business. He wants to become a wholesaler. To make it happen, he is going to grow his stock of merchandise. He is going to educate his children with the profit that he will make from his business.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of sugar, salt and soap for sale in his store

loans.name: Lyova

texts.ru:
Лева родился  в 1958 году в городе Капане. Он окончил Ереванское Педагогическое училище, и по специальности он учитель истории. 
Лева женат и у него двое детей: сын и дочь. Сын женат и живет отдельно от родителей, дочь окончила Ереванское Педагогическое училище и сейчас проживает вместе с матерью в Ереване. Лева в данный момент живет со своим отцом-пенсионером. 
Лева более 7 лет является руководителем благотворительной организации, которая организует бесплатную раздачу еды малоимущим пожилым людям. Параллельно со своей работой, Лева занимается выращиванием овощей, фруктов и ягод на продажу начиная с 1990 года. У него есть участок земли в деревне Багабурдж (Baghaburj), Сьюникской области, где он выращивает яблоки, груши, клубнику, зелень и т.д. У него много постоянных клиентов как в самой деревне, так и в городе Капане.     
 Лева является клиентом организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon) уже на протяжении многих лет, и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 900.000 драм для постройки теплицы. В теплице Лева сможет выращивать клубнику и зелень круглый год, что позволит ему увеличить доход своей семьи в будущем.
texts.en:
Lyova was born in 1958 in the town of Kapan. He graduated from Yerevan Pedagogical School and by specialty he is a history teacher. 
 
Lyova is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. His son is married and lives separately from his parents; his daughter graduated from Yerevan Pedagogical School and now lives with her mother in Yerevan. Lyova currently lives with his retired father. 

For more than seven years, Lyova has been the head of a charitable organization that organizes free distribution of food to low-income seniors. In parallel with his work, Lyova is engaged in growing vegetables, fruits and berries for sale since 1990. He has a plot of land in the village of Baghaburj, Syunikskoy district, where he grows apples, pears, strawberries, greens, and the like. He has many loyal customers in the village and also in Kapan.     
 
Lyova has been a client of Nor Horizon for many years, and now he needs a loan of 900,000 drams for the construction of a greenhouse. In the greenhouse, Lyova can grown strawberries and greens year round, allowing him to increase the income for his family in the future.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Herminia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 2 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad que trabajan de forma independiente.
Herminia cuenta que tiene una Frutería y Verdulería en el Mercado Municipal de Santaní, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ya pudo formarse una buena clientela, y como consecuencia un buen ingreso. Ella comenta que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos, para poder tener una vejez sin problemas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar frutas de estación, como ser melones, sandías, uvas, y demás con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Herminia is from the city of Santaní. She is 64 years old, widowed, and has two grown children who work independently. She has a fruit and vegetable stand at the municipal market in Santaní. Thanks to the high quality of products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.

Herminia is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, grapes, and other types of products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is married and has two children aged three and six. He is an optimistic and ambitious man. Kennedy has been running an elementary school for the last five years. He has seven employees. His business challenge is the high cost of stationery such as textbooks. He will use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stationery such as textbooks and exercise books, pens, etc. Kennedy hopes to expand his school into a boarding school in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy stationery.

loans.name: Aren

texts.es: A sus 36 años de edad, el señor Aren se dedica a cultivar en su finca arveja y papa capira con la ayuda de su esposa para luego venderla a legumbrerias del municipio de Sonson ubicado al norte de Antioquia. Esta actividad, el señor Aren la aprendió desde muy corta edad cuando le ayudaba a su padre en las labores del campo. Debido a la ola invernal que se ha presentado, los cultivos del señor Aren se han deteriorado y disminuido producción, por lo que requiere de la compra de abonos e insumos con los cuales el señor Aren puede hacerles mantenimiento, recuperarlos, mejorar su calidad y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
At 36 years of age, Sr. Aren has a farm where he grows peas and capira potatoes with the help of his wife. They sell these legumes in the town of Sonson, which is to the north of Antioquia. Sr. Aren learned this business at a very young age by helping his father with the farm work. As a result of the cold weather that has arrived, his crops have deteriorated and decreased in production.

He needs to buy compost and farming supplies so that he can maintain his crops and enable them to recover and improve in quality. This will help improve his income and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Mrs Gai is requesting this loan for her son, a first-year university student studying to become a popaganda trainer. After his four years of university, he hopes to work for the Department of Propaganda and Education with the local commitee.  Now studying hard to obtain his goal, he needs 10,935,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees, books and supplies.

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Inès (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Inès a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. Inès vit seule avec son unique enfant. Inès assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Inès a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Depuis sept ans, Inès vend des cartes de recharges, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables dans son atelier. Inès achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Inès et les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: WANGNINAGBE is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Inès (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 34 and no longer lives with her husband. Inès has one dependent child who goes to school. She lives by herself with her only child. Inès provides for herself and her child. She quit school at the primary level. Inès has been selling refill cards for prepaid phones for 7 years, which she does from her workshop and brings a substantial profit. Inès buys those items in Benin. It is the first time that Inès and the other members of WANGNINAGBE are applying for financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to strengthen their business and to better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy refill cards for prepaid phones.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades que hacen fomentar su compañerismo y trabajo en equipo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades para recaudar fondos para afrontar cualquier inconveniente.
Andresa es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que día a día empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y termina ya muy entrada la noche. Trabaja en la despensa que tiene, ya que todos los días van hasta su negocio muchos clientes, comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene un local bien surtido.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder seguir abasteciendo su local con productos de primera necesidad, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás. Ella esta muy contenta por la oportunidad que se le está dando, y lo agradece.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Cayetano” was formed by several neighbors from the city of Santaní who have joined together. All of them have developed independent businesses, but they also engage in activities that strengthen their camaraderie and help them to work as a team. The members have formed a very close-knit group and they are capable of working together in their fundraising events so that they can resolve any challenge that they may face.

Andrea is a hardworking and determined woman. Day after day, she begins her work in the early morning hours and does not finish until late at night. She manages a food pantry. Many customers come to her business every day. Andrea says that she has done very well because her shop is well-stocked.

She is requesting a loan so that she can continue to restock her shop with basic necessities such as food, beverages, dairy products, baked goods, and other items. She is very pleased with the opportunity being given to her. For this reason, she is grateful.

loans.use: to buy food, beverages, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Mansavo Group

texts.fr: MANSAVO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Colette Agossi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans. Colette Agossi est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Pierre. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Colette Agossi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Colette Agossi n’a pas fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Colette Agossi vend depuis une trentaine d’années, divers produits (conserves, etc.) par le système de distribution. Colette Agossi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Colette Agossi sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec le second membre du groupe MANSAVO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MANSAVO is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group representative, Colette Agossi (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 41. Colette Agossi is married to a mattress maker called Pierre. They care for their 4 children, who all go to school. Colette Agossi lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. Colette Agossi never went to school. To meet the financial needs of her family, Colette Agossi has been selling miscellaneous items (canned food, etc.) through the distribution system for about 30 years. She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Colette Agossi, along with the other member of MANSAVO, is applying for a second loan from ALIDé. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to better meet the needs of their customers and make more profit. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items (canned food, etc.).

loans.name: Sainte Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAINTE TRINITE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Sèwanou Emma est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèwanou Emma est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Sèwanou Emma a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Sèwanou Emma ne vit plus avec son mari et n’a aucun enfant. Sèwanou Emma vit seule et assure seule ses divers besoins. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Sèwanou Emma vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des céréales et des savons à son domicile. Sèwanou Emma s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sèwanou Emma sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAINTE TRINITE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: SAINTE TRINITÉ is a group composed of 3 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Sèwanou Emma, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Sèwanou Emma is 32 and lives in Benin. She quit school at the primary level. Sèwanou Emma no longer lives with her husband and she doesn't have any children. Sèwanou Emma lives on her own and provides for herself. In order to meet her financial needs, Sèwanou Emma has been selling ceral and soap céréales et des savons at home for about 10 years. Sèwanou Emma buys those items in a market in Benin, and in the North of Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Sèwanou Emma, along with the other members of SAINTE TRINITÉ, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy cereal and soap.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik, who was born in Yerevan in 1968, is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband works in an ice-cream factory, while her son has already returned from the army and now is working and helping his parents. Nazik's daughter is a student.

For 11 years Nazik has been selling fruits and vegetables, initially from a rented stall but now from a small rented shop board at the food market. Early each morning she buys fruits and vegetables wholesale and then transports them to her shop board. Her customers from her previous business location continue to patronize her new site, and her profits allow Nazik to take care of the needs of her family and pay for her daughter’s education.

Nazik is now requesting a 300,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables to resell in advance of the New Year’s holidays, when the trade is very active. This will be her third loan from Kiva and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fruits and vegetables to resell in advance of the New Year’s holidays.

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sabira Aurore est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sabira Aurore est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Sabira Aurore a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Sabira Aurore est mariée à un certain Pierrot. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sabira Aurore vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile. Sabira Aurore s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sabira Aurore sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe ENAGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: ENAGNON is a group composed of 2 people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Sabira Aurore, is the one raising her hand on the picture. She is 32 and lives in Bénin. Sabira Aurore quit school at the primary level. She is married to a man named Pierrot. They care for their 2 children, who both go to school. They both take care of the family financially. To meet the financial needs of her family, Sabira Aurore has been selling miscellaneous items (pasta, etc.) at home for about 15 years. She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Sabira Aurore, along with the other member of ENAGNON, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items (pasta, etc.)

loans.name: Fifonsi Aa1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI AA1 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Germaine Paulette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Germaine Paulette est âgée de 50 ans et une veuve. Germaine Paulette est mère de six enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Germaine Paulette vit seule avec ses deux enfants encore à charge et assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Germaine Paulette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Germaine Paulette exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture au Bénin, et de façon secondaire, la vente de maïs, des charbons de bois. Germaine Paulette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Germaine Paulette désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Germaine Paulette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI AA1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: FIFONSI AA1 is a group composed of 3 people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group representative, Germaine Paulette, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Germaine Paulette, 50, is a widow. She is the mother of 6 children, all of whom go to school. Two of them are still her dependents. Germaine Paulette lives with her two dependent children and, alone, provides for herself and her two children. Germaine Paulette never went to school. For about 30 years, Germaine Paulette has been selling food in Benin. In addition to that, she has been selling corn and charcoal. Germaine Paulette buys those items in a market in Benin. This occupation enables her to somewhat easily meet the needs of her family. In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Germaine Paulette would like to increase her stocks, and therefore her business. To that effect, Germaine Paulette, along with the other members of FIFONSI AA1, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and bags of corn.

loans.name: Review Samuel Karisa

texts.en:
Samuel Karisa is a 45 year old landlord in Kilifi. He is married and a father of two children. 

He has been doing this business for the last 20 years and he is doing great. He was introduced to KADET  and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase iron sheets to build more rental houses. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children and repay his loan. 
He hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to build more rental houses.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El  Sr. Juan es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Optaciana de 39 años de edad, tienen 2 Hijos, todos aun son pequeños y están en la escuela.
El se dedica a la producción y venta de carbón en su propia casa, cuenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que últimamente el carbón tiene mucha salida. Además de eso se dedica a la venta de leche y a la agricultura, el es un hombre muy emprendedor y trabajador, como se puede ver.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo cual podrá aumentar la producción de leche y de esa forma tener más en stock para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is from the city of Santaní. He is 43 years old and married to Sra. Optaciana, age 39. They have two young children who are in school.

Juan produces and sells charcoal from his home and has very good sales. He has had great success in this business as of late. Juan also sells milk and engages in farming. It is evident that he is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase milk production and have more inventory to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZOME I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia Yrene; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas, ella vende chompas de lana desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia también es profesora, por medio de este trabajo y negocio sacan adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es estudiar un maestría sobre su carrera de educación. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la mensualidad de maestría en la carrera de educación. 

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Sofia Yrene is a member of the Communal Bank “Comuzone I” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, single, and has one child. Sofia divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling sweaters. She sells wool sweaters from 8am to 6pm and is also a teacher. Through her job and her business, she is able to help her son move forward. Her dream is to study teaching and earn a degree in Education. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to pay her monthly tuition for her degree in Education.

Sofia is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to pay her monthly tuition for her degree in Education.

loans.name: Jericho Number One Group

texts.fr: JERICHO NUMBER ONE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Victoire (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 57 ans et est une veuve. Victoire a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent à sa charge. Victoire vit avec ses trois enfants à charge. Victoire assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis une quinzaine  d’année, Victoire vend des charbons de bois à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Victoire vend de l’huile d’arachide. Cette activité lui génère des revenus non négligeables. Victoire achète ses produits  dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Victoire et les autres membres du groupe JERICHO NUMBER ONE sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: JERICHO NUMBER ONE is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Victoire, 57 (the one raising her hand on the picture), is a widow. She has five children, all of whom go to school. Three are still her dependents. Victoire lives with her 3 dependent children. She provides for herself and her children. For about 15 years, Victoire has been selling charcoal at home. In addition to that, Victoire sells peanut oil. This activity generates a substantial income. Victoire buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to strengthen their business and better meet the needs of their customers, Victoire and the other members of JERICHO NUMBER ONE are applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia Evangelina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras,ella vende zanahorias,cebollas,tomates entre otras verduras,ella vende en el mercado desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local amplio donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,repollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Evangelina continues with her business of selling vegetables such as carrots, onions, tomatoes, and other items. She sells at the market from 7am to 6pm. Through this small business, she is able to help her children move forward. Evangelina’s dream is to have an expanded shop where she can sell vegetables. She is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and cabbages.

Evangelina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and cabbages in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocío es una mujer que se dedica a pleno a su único hijo de 15 años, ella hace todo lo que está en sus manos para poder sacar a su hijo adelante. A Rocío le hubiese gustado poder estudiar para convertirse en Abogada, pero por algunas complicaciones sus padres no pudieron pagarle la carrera profesional. Rocío es de la ciudad de Ica, la que se encuentra ubicada en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.

En la actualidad ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, en promedio trabaja 12 horas diarias, lo que le permite tener un ingreso de S/.44.

Ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito por la rápida atención que brinda a sus clientes, también se dedica al cuidado de niños con la finalidad de generar un ingreso adicional y pagar todos los gastos que asume mensualmente.
Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá implementar nuevas bebidas en su tienda, esto le permitirá satisfacer los nuevos pedidos de sus clientes, vender más y generar el dinero que necesita para poder cumplir su sueño “Tener una tienda bien grande”
texts.en:
Rocío is a woman completely dedicated to her only, 15-year-old, son.  She does everything in her power to move him ahead.  Rocío would have liked to  go to school to become a Lawyer but because of some complications her parents were unable to pay for her professional career.  

Rocío is from the city of Ica which is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country’s capital, and is called by Peruvians “The Land of the Sun.”  It is known in Perú for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its grape, asparagus and olive production and, above all, as the source of Perú’s traditional beverage, Pisco.  In this hot, arid climate we find the member’s house and her business.  She currently sells soft-drinks.  On average, she works 12 hours a day which allows her to earn an income of 44 soles.

She believes that her business is successful because of the quick customer service she provides.  She also works taking care of children to earn extra income and pay all her monthly expenses.

Thanks to Kiva lenders she will be able to stock new beverages in her store to fill new customer orders, sell more and generate the money she needs to reach her dream of “Having a really big store.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (soft-drinks and beer).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fabric, thread and thimbles to make outfits for boys and skirts for ladies.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
En la  Ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo de señoras con la idea de saber más sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, el cual les resultó una excelente oportunidad para salir adelante y progresar. El comite lleva por nombre Cristo Rey, debido a que hay una capilla del mismo nombre, está integrada por 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras quienes se sacrifican día a día para mantener a sus hijos y familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Catalina, quien se dedica a la costura. Ella nos cuenta que siempre esta con mucho trabajo, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos le hacen varios pedidos. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido mantener a su familia y ayudar con la economía de su casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para poder cumplir con la demanda que le hace sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, a group of women gathered together and came up with the idea of learning more about the Program of Women Entrepreneurs being offered by Fundación Paraguaya. This would result in an excellent opportunity for them to move forward and make progress. This committee is called “Cristo Rey” (Christ the King) because there is a chapel that has the same name. The group consists of 14 hardworking women who make sacrifices day after day to support their children and families.

One of the members is Sra. Catalina, who is a seamstress. She says that she always works a great deal because most of her neighbors place several orders. Thanks to her hard work and effort, she has been able to support her family and help with the household finances. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, scissors, and other necessary supplies so that she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, scissors, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Review Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a 26 year old posho (maize flour) mill owner in Kilifi.

He is married and a father of one child. He has been in this business for the last 5 years and he is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET  and this marks his third loan to finance his business. 

He plans to purchase spare parts and service his posho mill. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his child and repay his loan. 

He hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for and to service his posho (maize flour) mill

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 61 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella esa casada y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de cereales y de maiz y habas,tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y tambien ella prepara chicha que es una bebida a a base de maiz,ella sigue siendo un amujer emprendedora que por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales,maiz y habas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz y habas y tambien para comprar alimetos para los animales como cuyes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member Luisa is 61 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has one child. 

She continues to make her living in the business of buying and selling grains, corn, and broad beans. She also works in the business of animal breeding like guinea pigs and sells chicha, a drink made from a corn base. She continues to be an entrepreneurial woman who, through these small businesses, has helped her children get ahead. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her grains, corn and broad beans. The member is requesting a loan to buy corn and lima beans as well as to buy feed for animals like guinea pigs. 

She values and infinitely appreciates the loan she has been granted as it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time she is committing to make her payments according to the terms stipulated.

loans.use: to buy corn and broad beans and also to buy feed for animals like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 38 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche de vaca,ella lleva leche a la ciudad de Cusco  y tambien vende productos secos quinua,trigo ,maiz y cebada,ella tambien los productos lleva a lugares como las diferentes ferias que se llevan a cabo en el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio de la socia es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda vender la leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras para que amplie su negocio de venta de leche de vaca.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado
texts.en:
The member is Felicitas; she is 38 years old and a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has 4 children.

The member continues working in the sale of cow's milk. She takes the milk to the city of Cusco and also sells dry products: quinoa, wheat, corn and barley. She also takes her products to the different markets that take place in the Anta district.

The member supports her children through this business.

The member wants to sell her milk across a wider area. She is asking for this loan to buy two dairy cows so she can grow her cow's milk selling business.

The member values and is grateful for the offered loan as it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time she commits to fulfilling the payments of the instalments in the time stipulated.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to grow her cow's milk selling business.

loans.name: Cyprian Kinyua

texts.en: Cyprian is married and has a one year old daughter. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He has been running a retail store for the last three years. He sells items such as flour, sugar, rice, stationery, and paper. His business challenge is affording the high cost of goods sold. He will be using the loan (Kes20,000) to buy more stationery, sugar and rice. Cyprian hopes to diversify his business within the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of stationery, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales ytambien ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de granos como arbejas y habas,ella lo lleva a la ciudad de cusco y lo vende en el mercado y tambien tiene un pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros productos,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar la tienad de abarrores.La socia solicita el préstamo para compara granos como habs y arbejas y tambien para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business of raising animals, but she also engages in a business of selling dry goods such as peas and beans. She brings in these products from the city of Cusco and then sells them at the market. She also has a small grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and other products. Through these small businesses, she is able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. The member is requesting a loan to buy dry goods, such as beans and peas, and also animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

She values this loan and expresses her unending appreciation for the support that has been provided so that she can grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time, she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy peas and beans, as well as small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de 21 años, que tiene un pequeño de 1 año y 10 meses, ambos viven en casa del padre de Maritza, lugar donde tiene su pequeño negocio de abarrotes, ella pudo hacer este negocio gracias a que su padre la apoyo con el dinero necesario para inaugurar su negocio. Su padre se dedicaba anteriormente a este tipo de negocio pero cuando Maritza empezó a hacer uso de este, estaba muy entusiasmada y es por ello que amplió la variedad de productos, Maritza nos comenta que lucha mucho para algún día tener una bonita tienda y generar los ingresos necesarios para darle siempre una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a su bebé.

En la actualidad, Maritza también tiene otro empleo, al cual solo se dedica 2 veces por semana, este consiste en bañar a un ancianito (Desde hace 1 año), como muestra de su constante lucha para salir adelante, ella también tiene otro empleo, el cual consiste en trabajar en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de alcachofas, en este negocio ella no percibe muchos ingresos pero considera que siempre es importante tener un ingreso adicional para su pequeño Albeyro.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, esta mujer empeñosa y trabajadora tendrá la posibilidad de poder remodelar su tienda y comprar mas abarrotes ( arroz, azucar, enlatados, etc) para vender, esto le permitirá tener un mejor local para atender a sus clientes y estos se sientan felices al comprar en su tienda.
